en.title: Take a try
en.content: Click to view the complete code: Codesandbox

en.title: Step 1
en.content: Load <script> in the client's project:<!-- PageSpy SDK --> <script crossorigin="anonymous" src="{deployUrl}/page-spy/index.min.js"></script> <!-- Plugins (optional, but recommended) --> <script crossorigin="anonymous" src="{deployUrl}/plugin/data-harbor/index.min.js"></script> <script crossorigin="anonymous" src="{deployUrl}/plugin/rrweb/index.min.js"></script>

en.title: Step 2
en.content: Initialize PageSpy and the plugins. Both their initialization parameters provide optional configuration items for customizing the behavior of the SDK: - **DataHarborPlugin**: PageSpy itself only supports _online mode_, meaning "the client and the debugging side must be online simultaneously" during debugging. DataHarborPlugin enables offline debugging for PageSpy. Click [Offline Log](./offline-log) to see more details; - **RRWebPlugin**: Records user operation traces, using [rrweb](https://github.com/rrweb-io/rrweb/blob/master/guide.zh_CN.md) as the underlying technology. It's commonly used in conjunction with DataHarborPlugin. You can also customize your own PageSpy by [developing plugins](./plugins)! That's the complete process to integrate PageSpy into a browser project.Once integrated, click on the top menu Debugging to use it!

en.title: Integrate within frameworks?
en.content: PageSpy has published integration guides for all popular frameworks on the CodeSandbox platform. You can experience them online: ReactÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in React VueÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Vue SvelteÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Svelte AngularÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Angular NextjsÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Nextjs NuxtjsÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Nuxtjs

en.title: Using the Browser Extension
en.content: PageSpy provides a browser extension that allows you to use PageSpy on any webpage without integrating any code!Yes, you read that right! With the PageSpy browser extension, you can debug almost any webpage. However, a few websites with strict CSP policies may prevent the extension from functioning properly.

en.title: Install
en.content: Go to the Browser Extension repository and follow the README instructions to install it.

en.title: constructor()
en.content: Type interface DataHarborConfig {   // Specify the maximum bytes of offline log in memory.   // Default 10MB.   maximum?: number; // Only supported in browser   // Specify which types of data to cache   caredData?: Record<DataType, boolean>;   // Specify the offline log filename, with the default being named according to the current time   filename?: () => string;   // Custom the behavior of download   onDownload?: (data: CacheMessageItem[]) => void; // Only supported in browser   // The callback of upload done, which can be used to extend   // additional functionalities, such as notifying the developer   onAfterUpload?: (replayUrl: string, remark: string) => void; } declare class DataHarborPlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   constructor(config?: DataHarborConfig); }

en.title: Operate log manually
en.content: Manually download / upload offline logs. Type interface WholeLogActionParams {   clearCache?: boolean;   remark?: string; } interface PeriodLogActionParams {   startTime: number;   endTime: number;   remark?: string; } // NOTE! // - The browser supports the following 4 methods; // - The mini-program currently only supports the upload() method; declare class DataHarborPlugin {   // Full logs   upload(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   download(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<void>;   // time-period of logs   uploadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   downloadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<void>; } If the automatically rendered UI controls are hidden, or if you wish to automatically trigger operations on offline logs at certain times, this method can be used to achieve that. When operating on full logs, each time the user operates the log upload/download through the buttons on the modal, it is the complete log from the beginning to the end of the current session. However, when called manually, the recorded log data will be cleared by default and recording will start anew. You can control this by setting clearCache: false in the second parameter. Operating on time-period logs will not clear any data. After the upload is completed, the replay URL will be returned and printed to the console. Example window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // Upload full logs and clear data and re-record const url = await window.$harbor.upload(); // Upload the logs of the most recent three minutes. const now = Date.now(); const url = await window.$harbor.uploadPeriods({   startTime: now - 3 * 60000,   endTime: now,   remark: 'Add a remark to the problems that occur in this section of the log.' });

en.title: pause()
en.content: Pause recording. Type declare class DataHarborPlugin {   pause(): void; } More flexible control of logging behavior. The data generated by the program after the pause will not be recorded. Call $harbor.resume() to resume. Example window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // pause window.$harbor.pause(); // resume window.$harbor.resume();

en.title: resume()
en.content: Resume records. Type declare class DataHarborPlugin {   resume(): void; } More flexible control of logging behavior. Details Data during <Pause - Resume> will not be recorded. Example window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // pause window.$harbor.pause(); // resume window.$harbor.resume();

en.title: reharbor()
en.content: Clear the recorded data and continue recording. In short, remastered. Type declare class DataHarborPlugin {   reharbor(): void; } Example window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); window.$harbor.reharbor();

en.title: Deployments
en.content: Deploy with Node Deploy with Docker Install on Baota

en.title: Prerequisites
en.content: Install the Baota Panel by visiting the Baota Panel official website and selecting the appropriate script for installation.

en.title: Installation
en.content: Go to "Docker - App Store," find PageSpy, and click install. Set the basic information and click "Confirm." The panel will automatically initialize the app, which takes about 1 minutes. After initialization, the service will be accessible via port 6752.

en.title: Install
en.content: docker run -d --restart=always -v ./log:/app/log -v ./data:/app/data -p 6752:6752 --name="pageSpy" ghcr.io/huolalatech/page-spy-web:latest After completion, open the browser and visit http://localhost:6752 to access the service.

en.title: Install
en.content: After completion, open the browser and visit http://localhost:6752 to access the service.

en.title: PageSpy Module Composition
en.content: Dependency and interaction diagram between PageSpy modules:

en.title: Compatibility of PageSpy
en.content: The compatibility targets for browser SDK are set to ["chrome > 75","safari > 12", "> 0.1%", "not dead","not op_mini all"]; for other SDKs, refer to their respective repositories. Debugging primarily targets developers and maintains an open attitude towards new browser features. Therefore, it is recommended to use the latest browser versions with compatibility targets set to ["last 2 chrome version", "last 2 firefox version", "last 2 safari version"].

en.title: How to Hide the SDK Rendered Logo?
en.content: window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   // ... other configuration parameters   autoRender: false, });

en.title: Instantiation Parameters and Their Purposes?
en.content: See PageSpy API.

en.title: How to Update Initialization Parameters?
en.content: PageSpy provides a "Device ID" for identifying devices and also offers project / title for developers to customize information during initialization to aid in client identification. If you wish to update these parameters after initialization, follow these steps:window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy(...); // Calling updateRoomInfo updates project / title window.$pageSpy.updateRoomInfo({ project: 'xxx', title: 'xxx' });

en.title: How to Integrate with xxx Framework?
en.content: PageSpy has published integration guides for all popular frameworks on the CodeSandbox platform. You can experience them online: ReactÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in React VueÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Vue SvelteÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Svelte AngularÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Angular NextjsÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Nextjs NuxtjsÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Nuxtjs

en.title: Is pagespy.jikejishu.com an Officially Provided Domain? Will It Always Be Available?
en.content: https://pagespy.jikejishu.com is a temporary service set up by us to allow everyone to experience and learn PageSpy online. We do not guarantee 24-hour availability, data security, or assume responsibility for any losses. We strongly recommend deploying privately or within an intranet after experiencing.

en.title: Why Can Local Port 6752 Be Accessed, But Not When Deployed on a Server?
en.content: Check the server's firewall or security group rules to ensure port 6752 is open.

en.title: What Does "No client in the current connection" Mean on the Debug Button?
en.content: This usually indicates that the SDK successfully created a room but failed to join it via WebSocket. To troubleshoot: Check the console of the client where the SDK is running for any WebSocket connection failure messages. Verify server configuration if console shows "WebSocket connect failed" related errors.

en.title: How Should nginx Be Configured During Deployment?
en.content: Here's an nginx configuration for https://pagespy.jikejishu.com:server {   listen 443 ssl;   server_name pagespy.jikejishu.com;   if ($scheme != https) {       rewrite ^(.*)$  https://$host$1 permanent;   }   ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/pagespy.jikejishu.com/fullchain.pem;   ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/pagespy.jikejishu.com/privkey.pem;   location / {       proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;       proxy_http_version    1.1;       proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;       proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   } } server {   if ($host = pagespy.jikejishu.com) {       return 301 https://$host$request_uri;   }   listen 80;   listen [::]:80;   server_name pagespy.jikejishu.com;   return 404; }

en.title: How to Deploy to a Subpath?
en.content: Starting from version 1.5.4, you can deploy the service to a subpath. The installation process remains unchanged, but nginx configuration needs adjustment:server {   # ...   # <sub-path> should be replaced with the subpath you intend to deploy   location /<sub-path>/  {       # Ensure <sub-path> is consistent with above       rewrite ^/<sub-path>/(.*)$ /$1 break;       proxy_pass            http://127.0.0.1:6752;       proxy_http_version    1.1;       proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;       proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";       proxy_set_header      Host $host;       proxy_set_header      X-Real-IP $remote_addr;       proxy_set_header      X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;   }   # Ensure <sub-path> is consistent with above   location /<sub-path> {       return 301 $scheme://$host$request_uri/;   } } After adjusting the configuration, restart nginx to access via the subpath. During instantiation, manually pass api and clientOrigin to inform the SDK of the deployment address:window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   // For example api: "example.com/pagespy"   api: '<host>/<sub-path>',   // For example clientOrigin: "https://example.com/pagespy"   clientOrigin: '<scheme>://<host>/<sub-path>', });

en.title: How Can the Debug Terminal Be Protected with Some Authentication Mechanism to Allow Access Only to Authenticated Developers?
en.content: You can protect the server by setting an IP whitelist in nginx or using HTTP Authorization: Nginx IP whitelist configuration example: server {   location / {     # Allow who can access     allow <ip>;     # Deny all other clients except allow     deny all;   } } Nginx configuration for HTTP Authorization, requiring username and password for access. Generate username and password file using htpasswd: sudo htpasswd -c /etc/nginx/.htpasswd username Nginx configuration: server {   location / {     auth_basic "ËØ∑ËæìÂÖ•Áî®Êà∑ÂêçÂíåÂØÜÁ†Å‰ª•ËÆøÈóÆ PageSpy ÊúçÂä°";     auth_basic_user_file /etc/nginx/.htpasswd;     proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;     proxy_http_version    1.1;     proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;     proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   }   location ~ /(api|page-spy|plugin) {     proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;     proxy_http_version    1.1;     proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;     proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   } } Restart nginx.

en.title: Don't want to integrate manually into the project, is there a way to do it without invading the business project code?
en.content: PageSpy has prepared a browser extension for everyone, which provides the following features: Automatically injects the latest version of the SDK. Automatically completes the instantiation operation. Provides rules for domain injection configuration. Click here to use: HuolalaTech/page-spy-extension

en.title: Can I use a Tampermonkey script?
en.content: Refer to the following content:// ==UserScript== // @name         Inject PageSpy Script // @namespace    http://tampermonkey.net/ // @version      0.1 // @description  Inject script on xxx.yyy // @author       You // @match        <match rules, such as example.com> // @grant        none // ==/UserScript== (function () {   'use strict';   var script1 = document.createElement('script');   script1.setAttribute('crossorigin', 'anonymous');   // Replace the SDK URL with the actual project URL   script1.src = 'https://pagespy.jikejishu.com/page-spy/index.min.js';   var script2 = document.createElement('script');   script2.textContent = 'window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy();';   document.head.prepend(script1);   script1.onload = () => {     document.head.appendChild(script2);   }; })();

en.title: Business project is deployed on HTTPS, PageSpy is deployed on HTTP, what should I do if there is a console error?
en.content: Browsers block loading HTTP resources from HTTPS sites because HTTPS provides encryption and security, while HTTP transmits data in plaintext, posing security risks.It is recommended to upgrade PageSpy to HTTPS service directly to resolve this issue perfectly.

en.title: How to debug a specific user individually?
en.content: The simplest solution is to have users use the PageSpy browser extension, which is suitable when the client is highly cooperative and it's a PC project. However, this condition is quite stringent.So what if a H5 project in production wants to use PageSpy? It's clearly impractical to enable it for all users.PageSpy's effective process involves just two steps: Inject SDK via <script> tag in the head. Instantiate. PageSpy does not affect the project until the second step of instantiation. There are two approaches to debug a specific user: Dynamic HTML Response: If we can obtain a unique identifier for the user when requesting HTML, we can dynamically decide whether to inject <script> and instantiate logic before returning HTML to the user. User Gesture Activation: This typically requires the user's active cooperation. By default, inject the SDK but do not instantiate it, allowing the user to trigger debugging after a special gesture. Note: Besides technical implementation, attention to legal compliance and security risks is essential.

en.title: Page Panel Principle
en.content: The Page panel renders document.documentElement.outerHTML of the client to an iframe on the debugging end, allowing direct element inspection via local console.

en.title: Can the Page panel rendered on the client side interact directly?
en.content: It cannot interact directly. If interaction is needed, try entering code at the bottom of the Console panel and then checking the Page panel for interface feedback.

en.title: Page panel style is incorrect?
en.content: The discrepancy in rendering environments between client and debugging end (e.g., client's browser version is Chrome 75, debugging end's is Chrome 120) or network restrictions when debugging end accesses client-referenced resources may cause style discrepancies.Thus, styles are for reference only.

en.title: Can the Page panel completely restore client content 100%?
en.content: The SDK can "screenshot" the page and send it to the debugging end. However, due to: Larger data volume for images compared to text, increasing network transmission overhead. Adding to SDK size and complexity. For "style errors," remote collaboration allows testers to provide precise feedback to developers. Therefore, Page panel styles are for reference only.

en.title: How to modify API service configuration?
en.content: When you execute page-spy-api via the NPM package deployment method in the command line, a default configuration file config.json will be generated in the running directory. This file supports configuring the running port and multi-instance deployment: Modify configuration: {   "port": "6752", // Listening port   "maxLogFileSizeOfMB": 10240, // Log replay file save size (MB)   "maxLogLifeTimeOfHour": 720, // Maximum log replay file save time (hour)   "notAllowedDeleteLog": false, // Whether log replay deletion is allowed   "maxRoomNumber": 500, // Maximum allowed number of rooms   "corsConfig": {     "allowOrigins": ["https://test.huolala.com"], // Default configuration allows all domains for cross-origin requests     "allowHeaders": [       "Origin",       "Authorization",       "Content-Length",       "X-Request-Id",       "Content-Type",       "Referer",       "User-Agent",       "Host"     ],     "allowMethods": [       "HEAD",       "POST",       "GET",       "OPTIONS",       "PUT",       "DELETE",       "UPDATE"     ],     "exposeHeaders": ["X-Request-Id"]   } } Multi-instance deployment (requires version 1.5.0 or higher): The rpcAddress configuration is for multi-instance deployment, where ip and port are multiple machine IPs and RPC ports. Multiple instances communicate via RPC, and the program starts RPC services based on machine IPs to avoid message confusion due to duplicate IPs. {   "port": "6752",   "rpcAddress": [     {       "ip": "192.168.123.1",       "port": "20008"     },     {       "ip": "192.168.123.2",       "port": "20008"     }   ] }

en.title: Why does a globally installed package using pnpm cause errors when starting with pm2?
en.content: Globally installed packages with pnpm are wrapped by a shell script used by pnpm. Thus, when executing pm2 start page-spy-api, it finds a shell script, and pm2 cannot interpret and execute it, resulting in an error.Using yarn or npm installation resolves this issue. See related discussion: Unitech/pm2#5416.

en.title: How to upgrade to the latest version after a new release?
en.content: If using Docker deployment:# Update image docker pull ghcr.io/huolalatech/page-spy-web:latest # Stop running PageSpy container docker stop pageSpy && docker rm -f pageSpy # Run again docker run -d --restart=always -p 6752:6752 --name="pageSpy" ghcr.io/huolalatech/page-spy-web:latest If using NPM Package deployment:# Update package (yarn) yarn global upgrade @huolala-tech/page-spy-api@latest # Update package (npm) npm install -g @huolala-tech/page-spy-api@latest # Restart with pm2 pm2 restart page-spy-api

en.title: Under what conditions will a room connection be automatically destroyed?
en.content: View configuration: https://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-api/blob/master/room/local_room.go#L297-L323  If a room is created and no SDK or debugging end enters, it will be destroyed after 1 minute (this scenario does not exist in actual use). If both SDK and debugging end disconnect, it will be destroyed after 1 minute. If there is no data message interaction, it will be destroyed after 5 minutes. If the connection duration exceeds 1 hour, it will be automatically destroyed.

en.title: Why can't Alipay Mini Program get global objects like my.getCurrentPages() when executing remote code?
en.content: Due to historical reasons, Alipay Mini Program restricts access to global objects. This can be set via the mini program configuration file or Alipay Mini Program IDE: IDE: Details -> Compilation Configuration -> Global Object (global/globalThis) Access Policy: Accessible (recommended) Configuration file: https://opendocs.alipay.com/mini/03dbc3?pathHash=e876dc50#globalObjectMode

en.title: Why are uploaded file logs missing?
en.content: Uploaded file logs are by default saved for up to the latest 10 GB and 30 days, customizable via configuration modification. Uploaded logs are saved in the log directory under the runtime directory. In Docker runtime, if Docker is destroyed, logs will also be lost. Use directory mapping -v ./log:/app/log -v ./data:/app/data for persistence.

en.title: Step 1
en.content: Install the dependency in the HAP directory to be debugged:# API 9 ohpm install @huolala/page-spy-harmony@^1.0.0 # API 11 ohpm install @huolala/page-spy-harmony@^2

en.title: Step 2
en.content: Import and initialize the SDK at an appropriate place. Here, EntryAbility is used as an example. The initialization parameters provide optional configuration options to customize the SDK's behavior:import { PageSpy } from '@huolala/page-spy-harmony'; import axiosInstance from 'path/to/your/axios-instance'; export default class EntryAbility extends UIAbility {   onWindowStageCreate(windowStage: window.WindowStage) {     new PageSpy({       context: this.context,       api: "{deployPath}",       enableSSL: true,       axios: axiosInstance     })   } } That's the complete process to integrate PageSpy into a Harmony App project.Once integrated, click on the top menu Debugging to use it!

en.title: What is PageSpy?
en.content: PageSpy is an open-source debugging platform compatible with various platforms, including Web, Mini Program, React Native, and Harmony OS Apps. It encapsulates native APIs, filtering and transforming the parameters when native methods are invoked, and organizes them into a specific format for the debugging client to consume. The debugging client then provides a devtools UI to display this data.

en.title: Why is PageSpy?
en.content: A picture is worth a thousand words„ÄÇ

en.title: When to Use?
en.content: PageSpy shines in any scenario where local console debugging is not possible! Let's explore some use cases: Local Debugging of H5 and Webview Applications: While some products provide panels for viewing information on H5, small screens in mobile often make operations inconvenient, the display less user-friendly, and information might get truncated. Remote Work and Cross-Region Collaboration: Traditional communication methods like emails, phone calls, and video conferences often suffer from low efficiency, incomplete fault information, and can easily lead to misunderstandings and misjudgments. White Screen Issues on User Terminals: Traditional methods for locating issues, such as data monitoring and log analysis, rely on the troubleshooting team understanding the business requirements and technical implementations. Yep, the goal of PageSpy is can help the people which in like above cases.

en.title: Online Debugging
en.content: Console Panel: Displays logs from console.<log | info | warn | error | debug>, and allows sending code to be executed on the client side.  Network Panel: Shows information about network requests made by the client.  Element Panel: Displays the current client interface and allows viewing the HTML node tree.  Storage Panel: Allows viewing local cache data of the client.  System Panel: Displays the client's system information and checks for compatibility. Additionally, you will receive real-time notifications when new data is available or existing data changes.

en.title: Offline Debugging
en.content: The replay progress is under your control. As the replayer plays, you can view the client's operation trajectory and the corresponding data.

en.title: Step 1
en.content: Install the dependencies in the project. We provide SDKs for several mini-program platforms. Please install according to your needs:

en.title: Step 2
en.content: Add the PageSpy service domain name to the whitelist of http and websocket requests in the mini-program. Note that except for the development environment, the mini-program requires the use of https and wss protocols:https://<your-pagespy-host> wss://<your-pagespy-host>

en.title: Step 3
en.content: Import the SDK in the entry file and instantiate it. The initialization parameters provide optional configuration to customize the behavior of the SDK:import PageSpy from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-wechat'; const $pageSpy = new PageSpy({   api: "{deployPath}", })

en.title: Debugging panel
en.content: Call the showPanel() method on the created PageSpy instance to pop up a debugging menu for assistance with debugging:That's the complete process to integrate PageSpy into a mini-program project.

en.title: Why
en.content: Previously, PageSpy's online debugging solved many tricky problems, but there was a prerequisite for using PageSpy: "The client and the debugger must be online simultaneously." This prerequisite limited the use cases for PageSpy, for example: Two people (e.g. developer and tester) are required simultaneously to debug a problem. The connection is lost if the client moves to the background during debugging. It also imposed constraints on PageSpy itself, such as: Consideration for the size of collected data and the network transmission load. To address these issues and provide greater flexibility, PageSpy introduced the log replay feature in version 1.7.3!

en.title: Where do the logs come from?
en.content: After PageSpy's SDK supported plugin registration, the development team quickly advanced the DataHarborPlugin development. Data Harbor, the harbor of data. Concept: The data generated by PageSpy is continuously sent to the "data harbor". After organizing, packaging, and compressing the data, the "data port" stores the data in "containers" (memory or local temp file), awaiting further instructions. It internally listens for the "public-data" event (see what is the "public-data" event?) to enable offline data caching. It also provides features to handle log data from the SDK-rendered component. When an issue is found on the client, testers can directly upload / download the data. This innovation breaks the previous requirement of having "the client and the debugger online simultaneously."

en.title: Used in browser
en.content: If you only need the offline log replay functionality of PageSpy, we recommend using O-Spy for a simpler integration.

en.title: Step 1: Client-side SDK and plugin integration
en.content: <html>   <head>     <!-- 1. Load PageSpy -->     <script src="https://<your-pagespy-host>/page-spy/index.min.js"></script>     <!-- 2. Load DataHarbor plugin to cache offline data and download or upload log data -->     <script src="https://<your-pagespy-host>/plugin/data-harbor/index.min.js"></script>     <!-- 3. Optionally, load the RRWeb plugin to record user interaction traces into offline logs -->     <script src="https://<your-pagespy-host>/plugin/rrweb/index.min.js"></script>     <script>       // 4. Register plugins, see config details at: https://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/blob/main/packages/page-spy-plugin-data-harbor       PageSpy.registerPlugin(new DataHarborPlugin(config));       PageSpy.registerPlugin(new RRWebPlugin());       // 5. Instantiate PageSpy       window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({         // To avoid establishing a real-time connection between the SDK and the debugger, enable offline mode         // offline: true       });     </script>   </head> </html> After successful integration, a modal with upload and download buttons should appear when clicking on the client-rendered component.

en.title: Step 2: Replay the logs
en.content: Go to the debugger, click the top menu "Debugging - Log Replay" to enter the replay list page. Select the JSON data uploaded / downloaded in the previous step to start replaying!

en.title: Using with Other Plugins
en.content: DataHarborPlugin mainly collects and handles data. Additionally, PageSpy provides: RRWebPlugin: Uses rrweb to record DOM mutations. In the "Log Replay" panel on the left side of the debugger, devepler can see the user interaction traces.

en.title: Using O-Spy
en.content: The O-Spy SDK is plug and play, no deployment required. It packages PageSpy, DataHarborPlugin, and RRWebPlugin. It includes the best practice configurations for using PageSpy in offline mode and supports custom themes.It is framework-agnostic, so you can choose any method to integrate it into your project.import { ImportGuide } from '@/pages/OSpy/components/ImportGuide';Once successfully integrated, you will see a draggable "Issue Feedback" component appear in the bottom right corner.

en.title: Custom Theme Example
en.content: import { CustomizeExample } from '@/pages/OSpy/components/Customize';

en.title: Used in mini-program
en.content: The Log Replay feature also works in Mini Program. Please follow the steps below:

en.title: Step 1: Install the DataHarbor plugin for miniprogram
en.content: yarn add @huolala-tech/page-spy-plugin-mp-data-harbor

en.title: Step 2: Register the plugin:
en.content: import PageSpy from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-wechat'; import DataHarborPlugin from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-plugin-mp-data-harbor'; // register the plugin, see config details atÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/blob/main/packages/page-spy-plugin-mp-data-harbor const $dataHarborPlugin = new DataHarborPlugin(config) PageSpy.registerPlugin($dataHarborPlugin); const $pageSpy = new PageSpy({   // ... })

en.title: Step 3: Upload Offline Logs
en.content: There are two ways to upload offline logs: Call the upload() method of the plugin instance directly: $dataHarborPlugin.upload().then(() => {   console.log('Upload successfully'); })  With the DataHarbor plugin registered, there will be a new action button for offline log uploading on PageSpy panel:

en.title: Differences
en.content: DOM recording is not supported in miniprogram env, thus there is no RRWebPlugin for miniprogram. The offline log in miniprogram env supports uploading only, no downloading.

en.title: FAQ
en.content: How to upload / download logs manually? Click to see. Where is offline log data stored? After DataHarborPlugin receives the data, it first places it in an array in memory. When the data volume in the array reaches a threshold, it writes the data to a temporary file. By default, this threshold is 10MB. You can also configure it yourself:new DataHarborPlugin({   maximum: 1 * 1024 * 1024, // Write to a temporary file when the data in memory reaches 1MB })

en.title: constructor()
en.content: Create a PageSpy instance. Type declare class PageSpy {   constructor(config: InitConfig) } The constructor accepts a config object as an initialization parameter.

en.title: config.api
en.content: Server address. Type: string Details The SDK automatically determines the server address api and the debug endpoint clientOrigin based on the import path. For example, if you include the SDK with <script src="https://example.com/page-spy/index.min.js">, the SDK will internally set: api: "example.com" clientOrigin: "https://example.com" If your service is deployed elsewhere, you need to manually override this field.    This field is required.

en.title: config.clientOrigin
en.content: Type: string

en.title: config.project
en.content: Serves as a way to aggregate information and allows search in the debug room list. Type: string Default: 'default'

en.title: config.title
en.content: A user-defined parameter that can help distinguish the current debugging client.The corresponding information is displayed below the "Device ID" section on each debug connection panel. Type: string Default: '--'

en.title: config.enableSSL
en.content: Manually specify the scheme for the PageSpy service. Type: boolean Details Pass a boolean value manually: true: The SDK will access PageSpy services via ["https://", "wss://"]. false: The SDK will access PageSpy services via ["http://", "ws://"]. If not set, the SDK will automatically determine this value based on the page's URL. When the SDK cannot correctly determine the scheme, such as when imported through a browser extension like chrome-extension://xxx/sdk/index.min.js, it defaults to ["http://", "ws://"]. You can manually specify this field in such cases.    These environments generally enforce HTTPS, so the default value is true. For development environments requiring HTTP, you can set it to false.

en.title: config.disabledPlugins
en.content: PageSpy comes with built-in plugins ready to use. You can manually specify which plugins to disable. Type: string[]

en.title: config.serializeData
en.content: Indicates whether the SDK should serialize non-primitive data types when collecting offline logs. Serialization facilitates easier review during replay. Type: boolean Default: false

en.title: config.useSecret
en.content: Enable or disable authentication. Type: boolean Default: false Details: When enabled, the SDK generates a 6-digit random "secret key." This key must be entered when accessing the debug room.

en.title: config.messageCapacity
en.content: Maximum number of cached data entries. Type: number Default: 1000 Details: Before the debug room is entered, the SDK caches data in memory. This allows the debug client to view historical data upon entering the room. Since the data size may grow, you can specify the maximum number of data records the SDK caches locally.

en.title: config.dataProcessor
en.content: Customize data handling, allowing users to modify or ignore data. Type: declare interface DataProcessor {   console?: (data: ConsoleData) => boolean;   network?: (data: RequestItem) => boolean;   storage?: (data: StorageData) => boolean;   database?: (data: DatabaseData) => boolean;   page?: (data: PageData) => boolean;   system?: (data: SystemData) => boolean; } Details Processing functions correspond to built-in plugins. Users can directly modify the data within these functions. After execution, PageSpy processes the modified data. If a function returns false, the data will be ignored, meaning it won't appear in any debug mode. For more details, visit: https://www.pagespy.org/#/docs/changelog#v1_9_2

en.title: config.disabledOnProd
en.content: Disable PageSpy in production environments for Mini Programs. Type: boolean Default: true Details PageSpy is primarily intended for development and testing. It is not recommended for production environments, particularly for Mini Programs, where performance is more critical. Therefore, this field defaults to true.

en.title: config.offline
en.content: Offline mode. Type: boolean Default: false Details: With the offline replay functionality introduced in PageSpy@1.7.4, the integrated SDK can collect data and export offline logs without connecting to a debug client. Setting this to a truthy value enables "offline mode," where PageSpy does not create rooms or establish WebSocket connections. This is currently supported only in the browser environment.

en.title: config.autoRender
en.content: Indicates whether the SDK should automatically render a "white circular logo" control in the bottom-left corner after initialization. Type: boolean Default: true Details: If set to false, you can manually render using window.$pageSpy.render().

en.title: config.logo
en.content: Custom logo for the control rendering. Type: string

en.title: config.primaryColor
en.content: Set the theme color for modals and toasts. Type: string Default: #8434e9

en.title: config.modal
en.content: Configure the logo and title for the modal. Type: declare interface ModalConfig {   logo?: string;   title?: string; } Default: {   logo: "<PageSpy LOGO>",   title: "PageSpy" }

en.title: config.gesture
en.content: PageSpy can be activated via gestures or keyboard arrow keys. Type: Command | null„ÄÇ Gesture recognition relies on iseedeadpeople, where the Command type is defined as follows. declare const DIRECTION_CHARACTERS: readonly ["U", "R", "D", "L"]; type Direction = (typeof DIRECTION_CHARACTERS)[number]; type Command = readonly Direction[]; Default: null (gestures disabled). Example new PageSpy({   ...,   // PageSpy will only activate after the user completes the "Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right" input   // On mobile, this is done via gestures; on PC, it is triggered by arrow key inputs   gesture: ['U', 'U', 'D', 'D', 'L', 'R', 'L', 'R'], })

en.title: registerPlugin()
en.content: Static method, register a plugin. Type declare class PageSpy {   static registerPlugin(plugin: PageSpyPlugin): void; } Details Call before new PageSpy, the parameter is an instance of a plugin that implements PageSpyPlugin. Each plugin instance should have a name attribute. If a plugin with the same name is registered multiple times, the plugin instance will only be registered once, and a warning message will be printed in the console. Example class DataHarbrPlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   name = 'DataHarborPlugin'   ... // some code } PageSpy.registerPlugin(new DataHarborPlugin()); // Repeated calls, the plugin will only be registered once PageSpy.registerPlugin(new DataHarborPlugin());

en.title: pluginsWithOrder
en.content: List of registered plugins sorted by the enforce property of the plugin. Type declare class PageSpy {   static plugins: Record<PluginOrder | 'normal', PageSpyPlugin[]>;   static get pluginsWithOrder(): PageSpyPlugin[]; } Details Each plugin should provide the enforce: PluginOrder attribute; if not provided, it defaults to enforce: "normal". PageSpy will then maintain the plugin list in the order of pre - normal - post.

en.title: updateRoomInfo()
en.content: Update connection info after instantiation PageSpy. Type type UpdateConfig = {   title?: string;   project?: string; }; declare class PageSpy {   updateRoomInfo(obj: UpdateConfig): void; } Details The client identification information can be updated later through this method if it is not known when PageSpy is initialized. Example window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   title: '--',   project: '--', }); async function YourCode() {   const { title, project } = await xxx();   window.$pageSpy.updateRoomInfo({     title,     project,   }); }

en.title: abort()
en.content: Abort the current PageSpy instance. Type declare class PageSpy {   abort(): void; } Details PageSpy will disconnect, remove the relevant DOM from the document, clear the cached data, and call the onReset() method of all registered plugins. In the current context, APIs that are proxied or rewritten, such as window.fetch in the browser, will be restored to their state before PageSpy was instantiated. Example window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy(...); window.$pageSpy.abort();

en.title: version
en.content: Current used version of PageSpy. Type declare class PageSpy {   version: string; } Example window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy(...); console.log(window.$pageSpy.version);

en.title: config
en.content: Configuration information. The configuration varies depending on the platform, such as config.disableOnProd which is specific to the mini-program end. Type declare class PageSpy {   config: Config; }

en.title: socketStore
en.content: Encapsulates the WebSocket instance, provides message event listeners, triggers callbacks upon receiving specified messages, and broadcasts messages. Type interface SocketStoreType {   addListener(type: InteractiveType, fn: InteractiveEventCallback): void;   addListener(type: InternalType, fn: InternalEventCallback): void;   removeListener(type: InteractiveType, fn: InteractiveEventCallback): void;   removeListener(type: InternalType, fn: InternalEventCallback): void;   dispatchEvent(     type: InteractiveType | InternalType,     data: InteractiveEvent,   ): void;   dispatchEvent(type: InternalType, data: any): void;   broadcastMessage(message: MessageItem, noCache?: boolean): void; } Details The first parameter of addListener() / removeListener() / dispatchEvent() is the message type, which we categorize into "interactive" and "internal" types. "InteractiveType" message types are used to interact with the debugging client, for example: when the debugging client goes online, sends code to the client for execution, or clicks to expand object details, these will be sent to the SDK as message events, and the SDK will respond accordingly; "InternalType" message types are currently used for interaction between plugins. For example, after each plugin generates data, it will dispatch an event through socketStore.dispatchEvent('public-data'), and the DataHarborPlugin, also a plugin, can process the data upon listening to this event. The broadcastMessage() broadcasts a message. The first parameter is the data sent from different plugins to the debugging end, and the second parameter noCache is used by the plugin to inform socketStore whether the current message being sent should be cached. The purpose of caching the data is so that when the debugging end "comes online," it can see historical messages, but not all data needs to be cached. For instance, when a client send a network request, whether it succeeds or fails, only the final state needs to be cached. Example // Please check the repository for the specific implementation of ConsolePlugin class ConsolePlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   onInit({ socketStore }) {     socketStore.addListener('debug', ({ source }, reply) => {       ...     })     socketStore.broadcastMessage(...)   } }

en.title: showPanel()
en.content: Show the debugging panel in miniprogram. Type: declare class PageSpy { showPanel(): void; } Details: This panel supports plugin registration of custom buttons, for example, if the DataHarborPlugin is registered, a button of„ÄåUpload Offline Log„Äçwill appear in the panel:

en.title: Type Definitions
en.content: import { SocketStoreType } from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-types/lib/base'; import { PluginOrder } from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-types'; import { InitConfig } from 'types'; export abstract class PageSpyPlugin {   /**    * Each plugin must specify a name, which serves as its "identity".    * Functionality within PageSpy such as registration and disabling depends on this name property.    */   public abstract name: string;   /**    * Specifies the plugin loading order. Plugin invocation follows:    *   1. Plugins with enforce: "pre" property;    *   2. Plugins without enforce property;    *   3. Plugins with enforce: "post" property.    */   public abstract enforce?: PluginOrder;   // Called when new PageSpy() is invoked   public abstract onInit: (params: OnInitParams) => any;   // Called after PageSpy rendering is completed (if there's a rendering process)   public abstract onMounted?: (params: OnMountedParams) => any;   // When PageSpy is no longer needed, plugins should have reset/recovery functionality   public abstract onReset?: () => any; } export interface OnInitParams {   // Configuration information merged with user-provided instantiation parameters   config: Required<InitConfig>;   // Wrapper around the socket instance; plugin developers can interact with the debug terminal/API through this property   socketStore: SocketStoreType; } export interface OnMountedParams {   // Root node of PageSpy rendering   root?: HTMLDivElement;   // Root node of the dialog rendered by PageSpy   content?: HTMLDivElement;   // Wrapper around the socket instance; plugin developers can interact with the debug terminal/API through this property   socketStore: SocketStoreType; }

en.title: Behavioral Conventions
en.content: If a plugin collects (or want to publicly expose) certain platform "data", in addition to broadcasting data via socketStore, it is conventionally required to dispatch an "public-data" internal event on the socketStore instance. This allows plugins with statistical or persistence requirements to uniformly collect data from this event. Plugins that think certain data should not be "public" are not required to dispatch the "public-data" event.

en.title: Example Implementation of Plugins
en.content: Reference implementations can be found in DataHarborPlugin and RRWebPlugin.

en.title: Usage of Plugins
en.content: <!-- Include SDK --> <script src="https://<your-pagespy-host>/page-spy/index.min.js"></script> <!-- Include Plugin --> <script src="https://<your-pagespy-host>/plugin/xxx/index.min.js"></script> <!-- Register Plugin --> <script>   PageSpy.registerPlugin(new XXXPlugin());   window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy(); </script>

en.title: Step 1
en.content: Install the dependency in your project:yarn add @huolala-tech/page-spy-react-native@latest

en.title: Step 2
en.content: Import and instantiate the SDK in the entry file. The initialization parameters provide optional configuration options to customize the SDK's behavior:import PageSpy from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-react-native'; new PageSpy({   api: "{deployPath}", }) If you are using @react-native-async-storage/async-storage, we provide a separate plugin:import { PageSpy } from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-react-native'; import RNAsyncStoragePlugin from '@huolala-tech/page-spy-plugin-rn-async-storage'; PageSpy.registerPlugin(new RNAsyncStoragePlugin()) new PageSpy({   api: "{deployPath}", }) That's the complete process to integrate PageSpy into a react native project.Once integrated, click on the top menu Debugging to use it!

en.title: constructor()
en.content: Type import type { recordOptions } from 'rrweb/typings/types'; import type { eventWithTime } from '@rrweb/types'; interface Options extends recordOptions<eventWithTime> {   // Reserved configuration, not available for now   allowOnline?: true; } declare class RRWebPlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {     constructor(options?: Options); }

en.title: Relation of the O-Spy and PageSpy?
en.content: O-Spy is built on top of the capabilities of PageSpy and its plugin ecosystem. Specifically, it packages the following three dependencies: @huolala-tech/page-spy-browser; @huolala-tech/page-spy-plugin-rrweb; @huolala-tech/page-spy-plugin-data-harbor; The key differences between O-Spy and PageSpy are as follows: O-Spy PageSpy Requires deployment No Yes Online real-time debugging ‚ùå ‚úÖ Offline replay debugging ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Data upload üü° Handled manually ‚úÖ Data download ‚úÖ ‚úÖ

en.title: Where does the data recorded by O-Spy store?
en.content: All data is stored locally on the user's device, and will not be uploaded to any third-party server.The storage strategy: O-Spy stores data in an array in memory. When the volume of data in the array reaches a critical value, the data will be written to a temporary file. The critical value is 10M by default (click here to view the source code). When the page is refreshed, all data will be destroyed.

en.title: What is O-Spy?
en.content: O-Spy (pronounced /…ô ä spa…™/, similar to "Oh-Spy") is a debugging tool for offline recording program runtime data in web projects. The recorded data can be replayed using the O-Spy platform. Click to see the demo.The workflow is shown in the image below:

en.title: Step 1: Import O-Spy
en.content: O-Spy is framework-agnostic, and you can integrate it into your project in any way you prefer.import { ImportGuide } from '@/pages/OSpy/components/ImportGuide';Once successfully imported, you will see a draggable "O-Spy" widget at the bottom right of the screen. Try opening it :)import { CallOSpy } from '../md-components/CallOSPy';

en.title: Step 2: Export Data
en.content: This page already integrates O-Spy. Imagine it as your web page and let‚Äôs generate some data. Feel free to click the button below:import { MakeData } from '../md-components/MakeData'Then click the floating O-Spy button to open the popup and click "Export Log" to download a JSON file.

en.title: Step 3: Replay
en.content: Go to the replay page, click the "Select Log" button at the top left, choose the JSON file we just exported, and start the replay!

en.title: Example
en.content: import { CustomizeExample } from '@/pages/OSpy/components/Customize';

zh.title: v1.9.2
zh.content: üÜï ÂÆû‰æãÂåñÂèÇÊï∞Êñ∞Â¢û dataProcessor ÈÄâÈ°πÁî®‰∫éËøáÊª§ÊàñËÄÖÂ§ÑÁêÜÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇÊü•ÁúãËØ¶ÊÉÖÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/106; window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   ...,   dataProcessor: {     console: (data) => {       // ÊâìÂç∞ÂÜÖÂÆπ‰∏≠Â¶ÇÊûúÊúâ "secret" Â≠óÁ¨¶ÂàôÂøΩÁï•Ôºà‰∏ç‰ºöÂèëÈÄÅÂà∞Ë∞ÉËØïÁ´ØÔºâ       if (data.logs.some(i => typeof i === 'string' && i.includes('secret'))) return false;     },     network: (data) => {       // ÂøΩÁï•Êï∞ÊçÆÊâìÁÇπÁ±ªÁöÑËØ∑Ê±Ç       if (/(sentry|metric|collect)/.test(data.url)) return false     },,     storage: (data) => {       // cookie ‰∏≠ÁöÑÈîÆÂ¶ÇÊûúÊòØ‰∏ãÂàíÁ∫øÂºÄÂ§¥ÔºåËÆ©Ë∞ÉËØïÁ´ØÁúãÂà∞ÁöÑÂÄº‰∏∫ "*******"       if (data.type === "cookie" && data.action === "get") {         data.data.forEach((i) => {           if (i.name.startsWith("_")) {             i.value = "*******";           }         });       }     },   }, }); üÜï Ë∞ÉÊï¥‰∏ä‰º†ÁöÑÊó•ÂøóÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÊü•ÁúãËØ¶ÊÉÖÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/107; üÜï ‰∫§‰∫íË∞ÉÊï¥„ÄÇ ÁÇπÂáªÊó•ÂøóÂõûÊîæÁöÑËøõÂ∫¶Êù°‰øùÊåÅÊí≠ÊîæÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºåÊü•ÁúãËØ¶ÊÉÖÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/258; Ë°®Ê†ºÂ§¥ÊîØÊåÅÊãñÊãΩÔºåÊü•ÁúãËØ¶ÊÉÖÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/257; ÊîØÊåÅËØÜÂà´Âçé‰∏∫ÊµèËßàÂô®ÔºåÊü•ÁúãËØ¶ÊÉÖÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/256;

zh.title: constructor()
zh.content: Á±ªÂûã interface DataHarborConfig {   // Á¶ªÁ∫øÊó•ÂøóÊï∞ÊçÆ‰ºö‰ºòÂÖàËÆ∞ÂΩïÂú®ÂÜÖÂ≠ò‰∏≠ÔºåÂΩì‰ΩìÁßØËææÂà∞Â§öÂ§ßÊó∂ÂÜôÂÖ•‰∏¥Êó∂Êñá‰ª∂   // ÈªòËÆ§ 10M (10 * 1024 * 1024)   maximum?: number; // ‰ªÖÊµèËßàÂô®Á´ØÊîØÊåÅ   // ÊåáÂÆöÁºìÂ≠òÂì™‰∫õÁ±ªÂûãÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ   caredData?: Record<DataType, boolean>;   // ÊåáÂÆöÁ¶ªÁ∫øÊó•ÂøóÊñá‰ª∂ÂêçÔºåÈªòËÆ§ÊòØÊ†πÊçÆÂΩìÂâçÊó∂Èó¥ÂëΩÂêç   filename?: () => string;   // Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâ‰∏ãËΩΩÈÄªËæë   onDownload?: (data: CacheMessageItem[]) => void; // ‰ªÖÊµèËßàÂô®Á´ØÊîØÊåÅ   // ‰∏ä‰º†ÊàêÂäüÂêéÁöÑÂõûË∞ÉÔºåÂèØÁî®‰∫éÊãìÂ±ïÂÖ∂‰ªñÂäüËÉΩÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÈÄöÁü•ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖ   onAfterUpload?: (replayUrl: string, remark: string) => void; } declare class DataHarborPlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   constructor(config?: DataHarborConfig); }

zh.title: ÊâãÂä®Êìç‰ΩúÊó•Âøó
zh.content: ÊâãÂä®Êìç‰ΩúÁ¶ªÁ∫øÊó•ÂøóÁöÑ‰∏ãËΩΩ„ÄÅ‰∏ä‰º†„ÄÇ Á±ªÂûã interface WholeLogActionParams {   clearCache?: boolean;   remark?: string; } interface PeriodLogActionParams {   startTime: number;   endTime: number;   remark?: string; } // Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºÅ // - ÊµèËßàÂô®Á´ØÊîØÊåÅ‰∏ãÈù¢ 4 ÁßçÊñπÊ≥ïÔºõ // - Â∞èÁ®ãÂ∫èÁ´ØÂΩìÂâç‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅ upload() ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºõ declare class DataHarborPlugin {   // ÂÖ®ÈáèÊó•Âøó   upload(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   download(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<void>;   // Êó∂Èó¥ÊÆµÊó•Âøó   uploadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   downloadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<void>; } ËØ¶ÁªÜ‰ø°ÊÅØ Â¶ÇÊûúÈöêËóè‰∫ÜËá™Âä®Ê∏≤ÊüìÁöÑ UI Êéß‰ª∂ÔºåÊàñËÄÖÂ∏åÊúõÂú®Êüê‰∫õÊó∂ÂÄôËá™Âä®Ëß¶ÂèëÈòüÁ¶ªÁ∫øÊó•ÂøóÁöÑÊìç‰ΩúÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáËØ•ÊñπÊ≥ïÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ Êìç‰Ωú ÂÖ®ÈáèÊó•Âøó Êó∂ÔºåÁî®Êà∑ÊØèÊ¨°ÈÄöËøá UI ÂºπÁ™ó‰∏äÁöÑÊåâÈíÆÊìç‰ΩúÊó•Âøó‰∏ä‰º† / ‰∏ãËΩΩÈÉΩÊòØÂΩìÂâç‰ºöËØù‰ªéÂ§¥Âà∞Â∞æÁöÑÂÆåÊï¥Êó•ÂøóÔºõ‰ΩÜÊâãÂä®Ë∞ÉÁî®Êó∂ÈªòËÆ§‰ºöÊ∏ÖÈô§Â∑≤ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÊó•ÂøóÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÅÂπ∂ÈáçÊñ∞ÂºÄÂßãËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÁ¨¨‰∫å‰∏™ÂèÇÊï∞ÁöÑ clearCache: false Ëá™Ë°åÊéßÂà∂„ÄÇ Êìç‰Ωú Êó∂Èó¥ÊÆµÊó•Âøó ‰∏ç‰ºöÊ∏ÖÈô§‰ªª‰ΩïÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇ ‰∏ä‰º†ÂÆåÊàêÂêé‰ºöËøîÂõûÂõûÊîæÁöÑ URLÔºåÂπ∂ÊâìÂç∞Âà∞ÊéßÂà∂Âè∞„ÄÇ Á§∫‰æã window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // ‰∏ä‰º†ÂÖ®ÈÉ® const url = await window.$harbor.upload(); // ‰∏ä‰º†ÊúÄËøë 3 ÂàÜÈíüÁöÑÊó•Âøó const now = Date.now(); const url = await window.$harbor.uploadPeriods({   startTime: now - 3 * 60000,   endTime: now,   remark: 'ÁªôËøôÊÆµÊó•Âøó‰∏≠ÊâÄÂá∫Áé∞ÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÂä†‰∏™Â§áÊ≥®' });

ja.content: üÜï „Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„ÇπÂåñ„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„Å´ dataProcessor „Ç™„Éó„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíËøΩÂä†„Åó„ÄÅ„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅÆ„Éï„Ç£„É´„Çø„É™„É≥„Ç∞„ÇÑÂá¶ÁêÜ„ÇíË°å„Åà„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/106; window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   ...,   dataProcessor: {     console: (data) => {       // Âá∫ÂäõÂÜÖÂÆπ„Å´ "secret" ÊñáÂ≠ó„ÅåÂê´„Åæ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØÁÑ°Ë¶ñÔºà„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞Á´Ø„Å´ÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åõ„ÇìÔºâ       if (data.logs.some(i => typeof i === 'string' && i.includes('secret'))) return false;     },     network: (data) => {       // „Éá„Éº„Çø„Éù„Ç§„É≥„Éà„ÅÆ„É™„ÇØ„Ç®„Çπ„Éà„ÇíÁÑ°Ë¶ñ       if (/(sentry|metric|collect)/.test(data.url)) return false     },,     storage: (data) => {       // cookie „ÅÆ„Ç≠„Éº„Åå„Ç¢„É≥„ÉÄ„Éº„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç¢„ÅßÂßã„Åæ„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞Á´Ø„ÅßË¶ã„Åà„ÇãÂÄ§„Çí "*******" „Å´„Åô„Çã       if (data.type === "cookie" && data.action === "get") {         data.data.forEach((i) => {           if (i.name.startsWith("_")) {             i.value = "*******";           }         });       }     },   }, }); üÜï „Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„Éâ„Åï„Çå„Çã„É≠„Ç∞„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÇíË™øÊï¥„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/107; üÜï „Ç§„É≥„Çø„É©„ÇØ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíË™øÊï¥„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ „É≠„Ç∞„É™„Éó„É¨„Ç§„ÅÆÈÄ≤Ë°å„Éê„Éº„Çí„ÇØ„É™„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Åô„Çã„Å®ÂÜçÁîüÁä∂ÊÖã„Çí‰øùÊåÅ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/258; „ÉÜ„Éº„Éñ„É´„Éò„ÉÉ„ÉÄ„Éº„Åå„Éâ„É©„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂèØËÉΩ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/257; Huawei „Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅÆË≠òÂà•„Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/256;

ja.content: üÜï „Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„ÇπÂåñ„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„Å´ serializeData „Ç™„Éó„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíËøΩÂä†„Åó„ÄÅÈùûÂü∫Êú¨Âûã„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅÆ„Ç∑„É™„Ç¢„É´Âåñ„ÇíË®±ÂèØ„Åô„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉàÂÄ§„ÅØ false „Åß„Åô„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/103 / https://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/241; ÊúâÂäπ„Å´„Åô„Çã„Å®„ÄÅconsole „ÅÆ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Åå„É≠„Ç∞„É™„Éó„É¨„Ç§„Éö„Éº„Ç∏„ÅßÂ±ïÈñã„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   ...   // Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºö„Ç∑„É™„Ç¢„É´ÂåñÈÅéÁ®ã„ÅßÂâØ‰ΩúÁî®„ÅåÁô∫Áîü„Åô„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„Éà„Åß„ÅØ false „Å´Ë®≠ÂÆö„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô;   serializeData: true }) üÜï Network „Éë„Éç„É´„ÅÆË°®Á§∫ÊÉÖÂ†±„ÇíÊúÄÈÅ©Âåñ„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/239; üÜï „É™„Éó„É¨„Ç§„Éö„Éº„Ç∏„Åß canvas „ÅÆÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÇíÂÜçÁîü„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/238; üÜï „É™„Éó„É¨„Ç§„Éö„Éº„Ç∏„ÅßÊìç‰ΩúËªåË∑°„ÅÆË°®Á§∫„ÇíÊúÄÈÅ©Âåñ„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/244 / https://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/pull/247; üêõ „ÅÑ„Åè„Å§„Åã„ÅÆÂïèÈ°å„Çí‰øÆÊ≠£„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü;

ja.content: üÜï SDK „ÅåÊñ≠Á∂öÁöÑ„Å´Êé•Á∂ö„ÇíÂ§±„Å£„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅÊåáÊï∞Èñ¢Êï∞ÁöÑ„Å´ÂÜçÊé•Á∂ö„ÇíË©¶„Åø„Åæ„ÅôÔºàÂº∑Âà∂ÁöÑ„Å´„É´„Éº„É†„Çí‰ΩúÊàê„Åó„Åæ„ÅôÔºâ„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/78; üÜï SDK „Å´ useSecret „Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÇíËøΩÂä†„Åó„ÄÅ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉàÂÄ§„ÅØ false „Åß„Åô„ÄÇË®≠ÂÆö„Åô„Çã„Å® SDK „ÅØ„É´„Éº„É†„ÇíÁîüÊàê„Åô„ÇãÈöõ„Å´ 6 Ê°Å„ÅÆ„É©„É≥„ÉÄ„É†„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/78; üÜï ÂãïÁöÑ„Å´ title / project „Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÇíÊõ¥Êñ∞„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/78; üÜï „Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂ SDK „ÅÆ„Éï„É≠„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞„Éú„Éº„É´„Åå‰∏ä„ÄÅ‰∏ã„ÄÅÂ∑¶„ÄÅÂè≥„Å´ÈÖçÁΩÆ„Åï„Çå„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅËá™ÂãïÁöÑ„Å´Âèé„Åæ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/80; üÜï „Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞Á´Ø„ÅÆ„É´„Éº„É†„É™„Çπ„Éà„Éö„Éº„Ç∏„ÅÆË°®Á§∫„ÇíÊúÄÈÅ©Âåñ„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü; üÜï „Çµ„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÅÆ„É≠„Ç∞„Éá„Éº„Çø„Ç∑„É™„Ç¢„É´Âåñ„ÇíÊúÄÈÅ©Âåñ„Åó„ÄÅ„Éë„Éï„Ç©„Éº„Éû„É≥„Çπ„ÇíÂ§ßÂπÖ„Å´Âêë‰∏ä„Åï„Åõ„Åæ„Åó„Åü; üêõ „ÅÑ„Åè„Å§„Åã„ÅÆÂïèÈ°å„Çí‰øÆÊ≠£„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË©≥Á¥∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºöhttps://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy-web/issues/172 / https://github.com/HuolalaTech/page-spy/pull/79;

ja.title: constructor()
ja.content: ÂûãÂÆöÁæ© interface DataHarborConfig {   // „Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„É≠„Ç∞„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅØÊúÄÂàù„Å´„É°„É¢„É™„Å´Ë®òÈå≤„Åï„Çå„ÄÅ„Çµ„Ç§„Ç∫„ÅåÊåáÂÆöÂÄ§„Å´ÈÅî„Åô„Çã„Å®‰∏ÄÊôÇ„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É´„Å´Êõ∏„ÅçËæº„Åæ„Çå„Åæ„Åô   // „Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉàÂÄ§„ÅØ 10M (10 * 1024 * 1024)   maximum?: number; // „Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅÆ„Åø„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà   // „Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Åô„Çã„Éá„Éº„Çø„Çø„Ç§„Éó„ÇíÊåáÂÆö   caredData?: Record<DataType, boolean>;   // „Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„É≠„Ç∞„ÅÆ„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É´Âêç„ÇíÊåáÂÆö„ÄÅ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„Éà„ÅØÁèæÂú®ÊôÇÂàª„Å´Âü∫„Å•„ÅÑ„Å¶ÂëΩÂêç   filename?: () => string;   // „ÉÄ„Ç¶„É≥„É≠„Éº„Éâ„É≠„Ç∏„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Çí„Ç´„Çπ„Çø„Éû„Ç§„Ç∫   onDownload?: (data: CacheMessageItem[]) => void; // „Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅÆ„Åø„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà   // „Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„ÉâÊàêÂäüÂæå„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„É´„Éê„ÉÉ„ÇØ„ÄÅÈñãÁô∫ËÄÖ„Å∏„ÅÆÈÄöÁü•„Å™„Å©‰ªñ„ÅÆÊ©üËÉΩ„ÇíÊã°ÂºµÂèØËÉΩ   onAfterUpload?: (replayUrl: string, remark: string) => void; } declare class DataHarborPlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   constructor(config?: DataHarborConfig); }

ja.title: ÊâãÂãï„Åß„É≠„Ç∞„ÇíÊìç‰Ωú
ja.content: „Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„É≠„Ç∞„ÅÆ„ÉÄ„Ç¶„É≥„É≠„Éº„Éâ„Éª„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„Éâ„ÇíÊâãÂãï„ÅßÊìç‰Ωú„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂûãÂÆöÁæ© interface WholeLogActionParams {   clearCache?: boolean;   remark?: string; } interface PeriodLogActionParams {   startTime: number;   endTime: number;   remark?: string; } // Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºÅ // - „Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅØ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ4„Å§„ÅÆ„É°„ÇΩ„ÉÉ„Éâ„Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà // - „Éü„Éã„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„É†„ÅØÁèæÂú® upload() „É°„ÇΩ„ÉÉ„Éâ„ÅÆ„Åø„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà declare class DataHarborPlugin {   // ÂÖ®Èáè„É≠„Ç∞   upload(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   download(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<void>;   // ÊúüÈñìÊåáÂÆö„É≠„Ç∞   uploadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   downloadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<void>; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± Ëá™Âãï„É¨„É≥„ÉÄ„É™„É≥„Ç∞„Åï„Çå„Çã UI „Ç≥„É≥„Éà„É≠„Éº„É´„ÇíÈùûË°®Á§∫„Å´„Åó„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÇÑ„ÄÅÁâπÂÆö„ÅÆ„Çø„Ç§„Éü„É≥„Ç∞„Åß„Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„É≠„Ç∞„ÅÆÊìç‰Ωú„ÇíËá™ÂãïÁöÑ„Å´„Éà„É™„Ç¨„Éº„Åó„Åü„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„Å´„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆ„É°„ÇΩ„ÉÉ„Éâ„Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂÖ®Èáè„É≠„Ç∞„ÇíÊìç‰Ωú„Åô„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅUI „Éù„ÉÉ„Éó„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„ÅÆ„Éú„Çø„É≥„ÇíÈÄö„Åò„Å¶„É≠„Ç∞„ÅÆ„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„Éâ/„ÉÄ„Ç¶„É≥„É≠„Éº„Éâ„ÇíË°å„ÅÜ„Å®„ÄÅÁèæÂú®„ÅÆ„Çª„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÅÆÊúÄÂàù„Åã„ÇâÊúÄÂæå„Åæ„Åß„ÅÆÂÆåÂÖ®„Å™„É≠„Ç∞„ÅåÂØæË±°„Å®„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åü„Å†„Åó„ÄÅÊâãÂãï„ÅßÂëº„Å≥Âá∫„ÅôÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„Éà„ÅßË®òÈå≤Ê∏à„Åø„ÅÆ„É≠„Ç∞„Éá„Éº„Çø„Åå„ÇØ„É™„Ç¢„Åï„Çå„ÄÅÊñ∞„Åü„Å´Ë®òÈå≤„ÅåÈñãÂßã„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁ¨¨2ÂºïÊï∞„ÅÆ clearCache: false „ÅßÂà∂Âæ°ÂèØËÉΩ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ ÊúüÈñìÊåáÂÆö„É≠„Ç∞„ÅÆÊìç‰Ωú„Åß„ÅØ„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅØ„ÇØ„É™„Ç¢„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ „Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„ÉâÂÆå‰∫ÜÂæå„ÄÅÂÜçÁîüÁî®„ÅÆ URL „ÅåËøî„Åï„Çå„ÄÅ„Ç≥„É≥„ÇΩ„Éº„É´„Å´Âá∫Âäõ„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰ΩøÁî®‰æã window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // ÂÖ®Èáè„Çí„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„Éâ const url = await window.$harbor.upload(); // „Éá„Éº„Çø„Çí„ÇØ„É™„Ç¢„Åõ„Åö„Å´„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„Éâ const url = await window.$harbor.upload({ clearCache: false }); // ÊúüÈñìÊåáÂÆö„Åß„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„É≠„Éº„Éâ const url = await window.$harbor.uploadPeriods({   startTime: Date.now() - 1000 * 60, // 1ÂàÜÂâç„Åã„Çâ   endTime: Date.now(), });

ja.title: pause()
ja.content: Ë®òÈå≤„Çí‰∏ÄÊôÇÂÅúÊ≠¢„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂûãÂÆöÁæ© declare class DataHarborPlugin {   pause(): void; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± „É≠„Ç∞Ë®òÈå≤„ÅÆÂãï‰Ωú„Çí„Çà„ÇäÊüîËªü„Å´Âà∂Âæ°„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰∏ÄÊôÇÂÅúÊ≠¢Âæå„ÅØ„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„É†„ÅåÁîüÊàê„Åó„Åü„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅØË®òÈå≤„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ$harbor.resume() „ÇíÂÆüË°å„Åô„Çã„Å®ÂÜçÈñã„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰ΩøÁî®‰æã window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // ‰∏ÄÊôÇÂÅúÊ≠¢ window.$harbor.pause(); // ÂÜçÈñã window.$harbor.resume();

ja.title: resume()
ja.content: Ë®òÈå≤„ÇíÂÜçÈñã„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂûãÂÆöÁæ© declare class DataHarborPlugin {   resume(): void; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± „É≠„Ç∞Ë®òÈå≤„ÅÆÂãï‰Ωú„Çí„Çà„ÇäÊüîËªü„Å´Âà∂Âæ°„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰∏ÄÊôÇÂÅúÊ≠¢„Åã„ÇâÂÜçÈñã„Åæ„Åß„ÅÆÈñì„ÅÆ„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅØË®òÈå≤„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ ‰ΩøÁî®‰æã window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // ‰∏ÄÊôÇÂÅúÊ≠¢ window.$harbor.pause(); // ÂÜçÈñã window.$harbor.resume();

ja.title: reharbor()
ja.content: Ë®òÈå≤Ê∏à„Åø„ÅÆ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Çí„ÇØ„É™„Ç¢„Åó„ÄÅË®òÈå≤„ÇíÁ∂ôÁ∂ö„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Å§„Åæ„Çä„ÄÅÂÜçË®òÈå≤„ÇíÈñãÂßã„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂûãÂÆöÁæ© declare class DataHarborPlugin {   reharbor(): void; } ‰ΩøÁî®‰æã window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); window.$harbor.reharbor();

ja.title: PageSpy„ÅÆ‰∫íÊèõÊÄß
ja.content: „Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂SDK„ÅÆ‰∫íÊèõÊÄß„Çø„Éº„Ç≤„ÉÉ„Éà„ÅØ["chrome > 75","safari > 12", "> 0.1%", "not dead","not op_mini all"]„Å´Ë®≠ÂÆö„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰ªñ„ÅÆSDK„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Åù„Çå„Åû„Çå„ÅÆ„É™„Éù„Ç∏„Éà„É™„Çí„ÅîÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ „Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂÅ¥„ÅØ‰∏ª„Å´ÈñãÁô∫ËÄÖ„Åå‰ΩøÁî®„Åô„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅ„Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅÆÊñ∞Ê©üËÉΩ„ÅÆ‰ΩøÁî®„Å´ÂØæ„Åó„Å¶„Ç™„Éº„Éó„É≥„Å™ÂßøÂã¢„ÇíÂèñ„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åù„ÅÆ„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅÊúÄÊñ∞„Éê„Éº„Ç∏„Éß„É≥„ÅÆ„Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅÆ‰ΩøÁî®„ÇíÊé®Â•®„Åó„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅ‰∫íÊèõÊÄß„Çø„Éº„Ç≤„ÉÉ„Éà„ÅØ["last 2 chrome version", "last 2 firefox version", "last 2 safari version"]„Å´Ë®≠ÂÆö„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

ja.content: PageSpy„ÅØ„ÄÅCodeSandbox„Éó„É©„ÉÉ„Éà„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É†„ÇíÈÄö„Åò„Å¶„ÄÅÁèæÂú®‰∫∫Ê∞ó„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„Çã„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆ„Éï„É¨„Éº„É†„ÉØ„Éº„ÇØ„Å®„ÅÆÁµ±Âêà„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„ÇíÂÖ¨Èñã„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç™„É≥„É©„Ç§„É≥„Åß‰ΩìÈ®ì„Åß„Åç„Åæ„ÅôÔºö ReactÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in React VueÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Vue SvelteÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Svelte AngularÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Angular NextjsÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Nextjs NuxtjsÔºöCodeSandbox - PageSpy in Nuxtjs

ja.title: „Éá„Éó„É≠„Ç§ÊôÇ„ÅÆnginx„ÅÆË®≠ÂÆöÊñπÊ≥ï„ÅØÔºü
ja.content: ÂèÇËÄÉ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅhttps://pagespy.jikejishu.com„ÅÆnginxË®≠ÂÆö„ÇíÂÖ±Êúâ„Åó„Åæ„ÅôÔºöserver {   listen 443 ssl;   server_name pagespy.jikejishu.com;   if ($scheme != https) {       rewrite ^(.*)$  https://$host$1 permanent;   }   ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/pagespy.jikejishu.com/fullchain.pem;   ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/pagespy.jikejishu.com/privkey.pem;   location / {       proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;       proxy_http_version    1.1;       proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;       proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   } } server {   if ($host = pagespy.jikejishu.com) {       return 301 https://$host$request_uri;   }   listen 80;   listen [::]:80;   server_name pagespy.jikejishu.com;   return 404; }

ja.title: „Çµ„Éñ„Éë„Çπ„Å∏„ÅÆ„Éá„Éó„É≠„Ç§ÊñπÊ≥ï„ÅØÔºü
ja.content: „Éê„Éº„Ç∏„Éß„É≥1.5.4„Åã„Çâ„Çµ„Éñ„Éë„Çπ„Å∏„ÅÆ„Éá„Éó„É≠„Ç§„Åå„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Éà„Éº„É´ÊâãÈ†Ü„ÅØÂ§âÊõ¥„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åå„ÄÅnginx„ÅÆË®≠ÂÆö„ÇíË™øÊï¥„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„ÅôÔºöserver {   # ...   # <sub-path>„Å´„Éá„Éó„É≠„Ç§„Åó„Åü„ÅÑ„Çµ„Éñ„Éë„Çπ„ÇíÂÖ•Âäõ   location /<sub-path>/  {       # „Åì„Åì„ÅÆ<sub-path>„ÅØ‰∏äË®ò„Å®Âêå„Åò„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åô       rewrite ^/<sub-path>/(.*)$ /$1 break;       proxy_pass            http://127.0.0.1:6752;       proxy_http_version    1.1;       proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;       proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";       proxy_set_header      Host $host;       proxy_set_header      X-Real-IP $remote_addr;       proxy_set_header      X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;   }   # „Åì„Åì„ÅÆ<sub-path>„ÅØ‰∏äË®ò„Å®Âêå„Åò„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åô   location /<sub-path> {       return 301 $scheme://$host$request_uri/;   } } Ë®≠ÂÆö„ÇíË™øÊï¥Âæå„ÄÅnginx„ÇíÂÜçËµ∑Âãï„Åô„Çã„Å®„Çµ„Éñ„Éë„Çπ„Åß„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÊ≥®ÊÑèÁÇπ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„ÇπÂåñÊôÇ„Å´api„Å®clientOrigin„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÇíÊâãÂãï„ÅßÊ∏°„Åó„Å¶SDK„Å´„Éá„Éó„É≠„Ç§ÂÖà„Çí‰ºù„Åà„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„ÅôÔºöwindow.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   // ‰æãÔºöapi: "example.com/pagespy"   api: '<host>/<sub-path>',   // ‰æãÔºöclientOrigin: "https://example.com/pagespy"   clientOrigin: '<scheme>://<host>/<sub-path>', });

ja.title: „Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂÅ¥„Å´„Çª„Ç≠„É•„É™„ÉÜ„Ç£Ë™çË®º„ÇíËøΩÂä†„Åó„ÄÅÈñãÁô∫ËÄÖ„ÅåË™çË®ºÂæå„Å´„ÅÆ„Åø„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØÔºü
ja.content: „Çµ„Éº„Éê„Éº‰∏ä„ÅßIP„Éõ„ÉØ„Ç§„Éà„É™„Çπ„Éà„ÇíË®≠ÂÆö„Åô„Çã„Åã„ÄÅHTTPË™çË®º„Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„Å¶‰øùË≠∑„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ Nginx„ÅßIP„Éõ„ÉØ„Ç§„Éà„É™„Çπ„Éà„ÇíË®≠ÂÆö„Åô„Çã‰æãÔºö server {   location / {     # „Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„ÇíË®±ÂèØ„Åô„ÇãIP     allow <ip>;     # allow‰ª•Â§ñ„ÅÆ„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆ„ÇØ„É©„Ç§„Ç¢„É≥„Éà„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„ÇíÊãíÂê¶     deny all;   } } Nginx„ÅßHTTPË™çË®º„ÇíË®≠ÂÆö„Åó„ÄÅ„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„ÇπÊôÇ„Å´„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç„Å®„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„ÇíË¶ÅÊ±Ç„Åô„ÇãÔºö „Åæ„Åöhtpasswd„Åß„Ç¢„Ç´„Ç¶„É≥„Éà„Å®„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É´„ÇíÁîüÊàêÔºö # ÂÆüË°åÂæå„ÄÅ„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆÂÖ•Âäõ„Å®Á¢∫Ë™ç„ÅåÊ±Ç„ÇÅ„Çâ„Çå„Åæ„Åô htpasswd -c /etc/nginx/.htpasswd <„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç>; Ê¨°„Å´„ÄÅnginx„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É´„Åßauth_basic„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„ÇíË®≠ÂÆöÔºö server {   location / {     auth_basic "PageSpy„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„Å´„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç„Å®„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„ÇíÂÖ•Âäõ„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ";     auth_basic_user_file /etc/nginx/.htpasswd;     proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;     proxy_http_version    1.1;     proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;     proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   }   location ~ /(api|page-spy|plugin) {     proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;     proxy_http_version    1.1;     proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;     proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   } } ÊúÄÂæå„Å´nginx„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„ÇíÂÜçËµ∑Âãï„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

ja.title: Tampermonkey„Çπ„ÇØ„É™„Éó„Éà„ÅØÂà©Áî®„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÅãÔºü
ja.content: ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÇíÂèÇËÄÉ„Å´„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑÔºö// ==UserScript== // @name         Inject PageSpy Script // @namespace    http://tampermonkey.net/ // @version      0.1 // @description  Inject script on xxx.yyy // @author       You // @match        <„Éû„ÉÉ„ÉÅ„É≥„Ç∞„É´„Éº„É´„ÄÅ‰æãÔºöexample.com> // @grant        none // ==/UserScript== (function () {   'use strict';   var script1 = document.createElement('script');   script1.setAttribute('crossorigin', 'anonymous');   // ÂÆüÈöõ„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà„Åß„ÅØSDK„ÅÆ„Ç¢„Éâ„É¨„Çπ„É™„É≥„ÇØ„ÇíÁΩÆ„ÅçÊèõ„Åà„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ   script1.src = 'https://pagespy.jikejishu.com/page-spy/index.min.js';   var script2 = document.createElement('script');   script2.textContent = 'window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy();';   document.head.prepend(script1);   script1.onload = () => {     document.head.appendChild(script2);   }; })();

ja.title: Êñ∞„Éê„Éº„Ç∏„Éß„É≥„Åå„É™„É™„Éº„Çπ„Åï„Çå„ÅüÂæå„ÄÅÊúÄÊñ∞„Éê„Éº„Ç∏„Éß„É≥„Å´„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„Ç∞„É¨„Éº„Éâ„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØÔºü

ja.content: PageSpy„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„ÅÆ„Çπ„Ç≠„Éº„É†„ÇíÊâãÂãï„ÅßÊåáÂÆö„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂûãÔºöboolean Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± booleanÂÄ§„ÇíÊ∏°„Åó„Åæ„ÅôÔºö trueÔºöSDK„ÅØ ["https://", "wss://"] „Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„Å¶PageSpy„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„Å´„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Åó„Åæ„Åô falseÔºöSDK„ÅØ ["http://", "ws://"] „Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„Å¶PageSpy„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„Å´„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Åó„Åæ„Åô „Åì„ÅÆÂÄ§„ÇíË®≠ÂÆö„Åó„Å™„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅSDK„ÅØ„Éö„Éº„Ç∏„ÅÆ„Ç¢„Éâ„É¨„Çπ„Åã„ÇâËá™ÂãïÁöÑ„Å´ÂàÜÊûê„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ SDK„Åå„Çπ„Ç≠„Éº„É†„ÇíÊ≠£„Åó„ÅèÂàÜÊûê„Åß„Åç„Å™„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ‰æã„Åà„Å∞PageSpy„ÅÆ„Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂Êã°ÂºµÊ©üËÉΩ„Åå chrome-extension://xxx/sdk/index.min.js „Åã„ÇâSDK„ÇíË™≠„ÅøËæº„ÇÄÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„ÅØSDK„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶ÁÑ°Âäπ„Å™ "chrome-extension://" „Å®„Åó„Å¶Ëß£Êûê„Åï„Çå„ÄÅ["http://", "ws://"] „Å´„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É´„Éê„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åì„ÅÆÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆ„Éï„Ç£„Éº„É´„Éâ„ÇíÊâãÂãï„ÅßË®≠ÂÆö„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ    „Åì„Çå„Çâ„ÅÆÁí∞Â¢É„ÅØ‰∏ÄËà¨ÁöÑ„Å´https„ÇíÂº∑Âà∂„Åô„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„Éà„ÅØtrue„Åß„Åô„ÄÇhttpÔºàÈÄöÂ∏∏„ÅØÈñãÁô∫Áí∞Â¢É„ÅßÔºâ„Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØ„ÄÅfalse„Å´Ë®≠ÂÆö„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

ja.content: „Ç∏„Çß„Çπ„ÉÅ„É£„ÉºÊìç‰Ωú„Åæ„Åü„ÅØ„Ç≠„Éº„Éú„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆÊñπÂêë„Ç≠„Éº„ÅßPageSpy„ÇíÊúâÂäπ„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÂûãÔºöCommand | null „Ç∏„Çß„Çπ„ÉÅ„É£„ÉºË™çË≠ò„ÅØiseedeadpeople„Å´‰æùÂ≠ò„Åó„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆCommand„ÅØ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´ÂÆöÁæ©„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÅôÔºö declare const DIRECTION_CHARACTERS: readonly ["U", "R", "D", "L"]; type Direction = (typeof DIRECTION_CHARACTERS)[number]; type Command = readonly Direction[]; „Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉàÂÄ§Ôºönull„ÄÅ„Ç∏„Çß„Çπ„ÉÅ„É£„Éº„ÇíÁÑ°Âäπ„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰æã new PageSpy({   ...,   // „É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„Åå "‰∏ä‰∏ä‰∏ã‰∏ãÂ∑¶Âè≥Â∑¶Âè≥" „ÅÆ„Ç∏„Çß„Çπ„ÉÅ„É£„Éº„Åæ„Åü„ÅØÊñπÂêë„Ç≠„ÉºÂÖ•Âäõ„ÇíÂÆå‰∫Ü„Åó„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÅÆ„Åø„ÄÅPageSpy„ÅåÊúâÂäπ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô   gesture: ['U', 'U', 'D', 'D', 'L', 'R', 'L', 'R'], })

ja.content: ÈùôÁöÑ„É°„ÇΩ„ÉÉ„Éâ„ÄÅ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÇíÁôªÈå≤„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ Âûã declare class PageSpy {   static registerPlugin(plugin: PageSpyPlugin): void; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± PageSpy„ÅÆ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„ÇπÂåñ„ÅÆÂâç„Å´Âëº„Å≥Âá∫„Åó„ÄÅ„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÅØPageSpyPlugin„ÇíÂÆüË£Ö„Åó„Åü„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÂêÑ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„Å´„ÅØnameÂ±ûÊÄß„ÅåÂøÖË¶Å„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÂêå„ÅòÂêçÂâç„ÅÆ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅåÈáçË§á„Åó„Å¶ÁôªÈå≤„Åï„Çå„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„ÅØ‰∏ÄÂ∫¶„Å†„ÅëÁôªÈå≤„Åï„Çå„ÄÅ„Ç≥„É≥„ÇΩ„Éº„É´„Å´Ë≠¶Âëä„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„ÅåË°®Á§∫„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰æã class DataHarborPlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   name = 'DataHarborPlugin'   ... // „Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆÂÆüË£Ö } PageSpy.registerPlugin(new DataHarborPlugin()); // ÈáçË§á„Åó„Å¶Âëº„Å≥Âá∫„Åó„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅØ‰∏ÄÂ∫¶„Å†„ÅëÁôªÈå≤„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô // PageSpy.registerPlugin(new DataHarborPlugin());

ja.title: pluginsWithOrder
ja.content: „Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆenforceÂ±ûÊÄß„Å´Âæì„Å£„Å¶‰∏¶„ÅπÊõø„Åà„Çâ„Çå„ÅüÁôªÈå≤Ê∏à„Åø„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆ„É™„Çπ„Éà„ÄÇ Âûã declare class PageSpy {   static plugins: Record<PluginOrder | 'normal', PageSpyPlugin[]>;   static get pluginsWithOrder(): PageSpyPlugin[]; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± ÂêÑ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅØenforce: PluginOrderÂ±ûÊÄß„ÇíÊèê‰æõ„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÊèê‰æõ„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØ„Éá„Éï„Ç©„É´„Éà„Åßenforce: "normal"„Å®„Å™„Çä„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÂæåPageSpy„ÅØpre - normal - post„ÅÆÈ†ÜÂ∫è„Åß„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„É™„Çπ„Éà„ÇíÁÆ°ÁêÜ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

ja.title: updateRoomInfo()
ja.content: „Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„ÇπÂåñÂæå„ÄÅÊé•Á∂öÊÉÖÂ†±„ÇíÊõ¥Êñ∞„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ Âûã type UpdateConfig = {     title?: string;     project?: string; }; declare class PageSpy {   updateRoomInfo(obj: UpdateConfig): void; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± „ÇØ„É©„Ç§„Ç¢„É≥„Éà„ÅÆË≠òÂà•ÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅåPageSpyÂàùÊúüÂåñÊôÇ„Å´„Åæ„Å†‰∏çÊòé„Å™Â†¥Âêà„ÄÅÂæå„Åß„Åì„ÅÆ„É°„ÇΩ„ÉÉ„Éâ„Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„Å¶Êõ¥Êñ∞„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰æã window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy({   title: '--',   project: '--' }) async function YourCode() {   // „Éì„Ç∏„Éç„Çπ„É≠„Ç∏„ÉÉ„ÇØ„ÅåÈùûÂêåÊúü„Åß„ÇØ„É©„Ç§„Ç¢„É≥„ÉàË≠òÂà•Â≠ê„ÇíË™≠„ÅøËæº„ÇÄ„ÄÅ‰æãÔºöÁèæÂú®„ÅÆ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„ÄÅÁèæÂú®„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà   const { title, project } = await xxx();   window.$pageSpy.updateRoomInfo({     title,     project   }) }

ja.title: abort()
ja.content: ÁèæÂú®„ÅÆ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„ÇíÁ†¥Ê£Ñ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ Âûã declare class PageSpy {   abort(): void; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± PageSpy„ÅØÊé•Á∂ö„ÇíÂàáÊñ≠„Åó„ÄÅ„Éâ„Ç≠„É•„É°„É≥„Éà„Åã„ÇâÈñ¢ÈÄ£„Åô„ÇãDOM„ÇíÂâäÈô§„Åó„ÄÅ„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Åï„Çå„Åü„Éá„Éº„Çø„Çí„ÇØ„É™„Ç¢„Åó„ÄÅÁôªÈå≤„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆonReset()„É°„ÇΩ„ÉÉ„Éâ„ÇíÂëº„Å≥Âá∫„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÁèæÂú®„ÅÆ„Ç≥„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà„Åß„Éó„É≠„Ç≠„Ç∑„Åï„Çå„Åü„Åæ„Åü„ÅØÊõ∏„ÅçÊèõ„Åà„Çâ„Çå„ÅüAPIÔºà„Éñ„É©„Ç¶„Ç∂„ÅÆwindow.fetch„Å™„Å©Ôºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅPageSpy„ÅÆ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„ÇπÂåñÂâç„ÅÆÁä∂ÊÖã„Å´Êàª„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰æã window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy(...); window.$pageSpy.abort();

ja.title: version
ja.content: ÁèæÂú®‰ΩøÁî®‰∏≠„ÅÆPageSpy„ÅÆ„Éê„Éº„Ç∏„Éß„É≥„ÄÇ Âûã declare class PageSpy {   version: string; } ‰æã window.$pageSpy = new PageSpy(...); console.log(window.$pageSpy.version);

ja.title: config
ja.content: Ë®≠ÂÆöÊÉÖÂ†±„ÄÇË®≠ÂÆö„ÅØ„Éó„É©„ÉÉ„Éà„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É†„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶Áï∞„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰æã„Åà„Å∞„ÄÅ„Éü„Éã„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„É†Âêë„Åë„ÅÆconfig.disableOnProd„Å™„Å©„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ Âûã declare class PageSpy {   config: Config; }

ja.title: socketStore
ja.content: WebSocket„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„Çí„É©„ÉÉ„Éó„Åó„ÄÅ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„ÅÆÁôªÈå≤„ÄÅÊåáÂÆö„Åï„Çå„Åü„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏Âèó‰ø°Âæå„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„É´„Éê„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éà„É™„Ç¨„Éº„ÄÅ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„ÅÆ„Éñ„É≠„Éº„Éâ„Ç≠„É£„Çπ„Éà„ÇíÊèê‰æõ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ Âûã interface SocketStoreType {   addListener(type: InteractiveType, fn: InteractiveEventCallback): void;   addListener(type: InternalType, fn: InternalEventCallback): void;   removeListener(type: InteractiveType, fn: InteractiveEventCallback): void;   removeListener(type: InternalType, fn: InternalEventCallback): void;   dispatchEvent(type: InteractiveType | InternalType, data: InteractiveEvent): void;   dispatchEvent(type: InternalType, data: any): void;   broadcastMessage(message: MessageItem, noCache?: boolean): void; } Ë©≥Á¥∞ÊÉÖÂ†± addListener() / removeListener() / dispatchEvent()„ÅÆÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÂºïÊï∞„ÅØ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Çø„Ç§„Éó„Åß„ÄÅ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Çø„Ç§„Éó„ÅØ**„ÄåÂØæË©±Âûã„Äç„Å®„ÄåÂÜÖÈÉ®Âûã„Äç**„ÅÆ2Á®ÆÈ°û„Å´ÂàÜÈ°û„Åï„Çå„Åæ„ÅôÔºö **„ÄåÂØæË©±Âûã„Äç**„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Çø„Ç§„Éó„ÅØ„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂÅ¥„Å®„ÅÆÂØæË©±„Å´‰ΩøÁî®„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰æãÔºö„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂÅ¥„ÅÆ„Ç™„É≥„É©„Ç§„É≥Âåñ„ÄÅ„ÇØ„É©„Ç§„Ç¢„É≥„Éà„Å∏„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„ÉâÂÆüË°åÈÄÅ‰ø°„ÄÅ„Ç™„Éñ„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„ÉàË©≥Á¥∞„ÅÆÂ±ïÈñã„ÇØ„É™„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Å™„Å©„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„Çâ„ÅØ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„Å®„Åó„Å¶SDK„Å´ÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åï„Çå„ÄÅSDK„ÅØÂøÖË¶Å„Å´Âøú„Åò„Å¶ÂøúÁ≠î„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ **„ÄåÂÜÖÈÉ®Âûã„Äç**„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Çø„Ç§„Éó„ÅØÁèæÂú®„ÄÅ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥Èñì„ÅÆÂØæË©±„Å´‰ΩøÁî®„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰æãÔºöÂêÑ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Åå„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÇíÁîüÊàê„Åó„ÅüÂæå„ÄÅsocketStore.dispatchEvent('public-data')„Åß„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„ÇíÁô∫Ë°å„Åó„ÄÅÂêå„Åò„Åè„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Åß„ÅÇ„ÇãDataHarborPlugin„Åå„Åì„ÅÆ„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„ÇíÁõ£Ë¶ñ„Åó„Å¶„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÇíÂà•ÈÄîÂá¶ÁêÜ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ broadcastMessage()„ÅØ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Çí„Éñ„É≠„Éº„Éâ„Ç≠„É£„Çπ„Éà„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÂºïÊï∞„ÅØÂêÑ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Åã„Çâ„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂÅ¥„Å´ÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åï„Çå„Çã„Éá„Éº„Çø„Åß„ÄÅÁ¨¨‰∫åÂºïÊï∞„ÅÆnoCache„ÅØ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅåsocketStore„Å´ÁèæÂú®ÈÄÅ‰ø°‰∏≠„ÅÆ„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„Çí„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Åô„Åπ„Åç„Åã„Å©„ÅÜ„Åã„ÇíÈÄöÁü•„Åô„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„Å´‰ΩøÁî®„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Çí„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Åô„ÇãÁõÆÁöÑ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞ÂÅ¥„Åå„Äå„Ç™„É≥„É©„Ç§„É≥„Äç„Å´„Å™„Å£„ÅüÂæå„Å´Â±•Ê≠¥„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Éº„Ç∏„ÇíÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Çí„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„ÅØ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ‰æãÔºö„ÇØ„É©„Ç§„Ç¢„É≥„Éà„Åå„Éç„ÉÉ„Éà„ÉØ„Éº„ÇØ„É™„ÇØ„Ç®„Çπ„Éà„ÇíÈñãÂßã„Åó„ÅüÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅÊàêÂäü„Åæ„Åü„ÅØÂ§±Êïó„Å´„Åã„Åã„Çè„Çâ„Åö„ÄÅÊúÄÁµÇÁä∂ÊÖã„ÅÆ„Åø„Çí„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ‰æã // ConsolePlugin„ÅÆÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑ„Å™ÂÆüË£Ö„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅØ„É™„Éù„Ç∏„Éà„É™„Çí„ÅîÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ class ConsolePlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   onInit({ socketStore }) {     socketStore.addListener('debug', ({ source }, reply) => {       ...     })     socketStore.broadcastMessage(...)   } }

ja.title: showPanel()

ÌÉÄÏûÖ Ï†ïÏùò interface WholeLogActionParams {   clearCache?: boolean;   remark?: string; } interface PeriodLogActionParams {   startTime: number;   endTime: number;   remark?: string; } // Ï£ºÏùò! // - Î∏åÎùºÏö∞Ï†ÄÎäî ÏïÑÎûò 4Í∞ÄÏßÄ Î©îÏÑúÎìúÎ•º ÏßÄÏõê // - ÎØ∏Îãà ÌîÑÎ°úÍ∑∏Îû®ÏùÄ ÌòÑÏû¨ upload() Î©îÏÑúÎìúÎßå ÏßÄÏõê declare class DataHarborPlugin {   // Ï†ÑÏ≤¥ Î°úÍ∑∏   upload(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   download(params?: WholeLogActionParams): Promise<void>;   // Í∏∞Í∞ÑÎ≥Ñ Î°úÍ∑∏   uploadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<string>;   downloadPeriods(params: PeriodLogActionParams): Promise<void>; } ÏÉÅÏÑ∏ Ï†ïÎ≥¥ ÏûêÎèô Î†åÎçîÎßÅÎêòÎäî UI Ïª®Ìä∏Î°§ÏùÑ Ïà®Í∏∞Í±∞ÎÇò ÌäπÏ†ï ÏãúÏ†êÏóê Ïò§ÌîÑÎùºÏù∏ Î°úÍ∑∏ Ï°∞ÏûëÏùÑ ÏûêÎèôÏúºÎ°ú Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞ÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂ÏùÑ Îïå Ïù¥ Î©îÏÑúÎìúÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÌïòÏßÄÎßå ÏàòÎèôÏúºÎ°ú Ìò∏Ï∂úÌï† Í≤ΩÏö∞ Í∏∞Î≥∏Ï†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Í∏∞Î°ùÎêú Î°úÍ∑∏ Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Í∞Ä ÏßÄÏõåÏßÄÍ≥† ÏÉàÎ°ú Í∏∞Î°ùÏù¥ ÏãúÏûëÎê©ÎãàÎã§. Îëê Î≤àÏß∏ Îß§Í∞úÎ≥ÄÏàòÏùò clearCache: falseÎ°ú Ï†úÏñ¥Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Í∏∞Í∞ÑÎ≥Ñ Î°úÍ∑∏ Ï°∞ÏûëÏùÄ Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º ÏßÄÏö∞ÏßÄ ÏïäÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÏÇ¨Ïö© ÏòàÏãú window.$harbor = new DataHarborPlugin(); // Ï†ÑÏ≤¥ ÏóÖÎ°úÎìú const url = await window.$harbor.upload(); // Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º ÏßÄÏö∞ÏßÄ ÏïäÍ≥† ÏóÖÎ°úÎìú const url = await window.$harbor.upload({ clearCache: false }); // Í∏∞Í∞ÑÎ≥Ñ ÏóÖÎ°úÎìú const url = await window.$harbor.uploadPeriods({   startTime: Date.now() - 1000 * 60, // 1Î∂Ñ Ï†ÑÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞   endTime: Date.now(), });

ÏÑ§Ïπò Í≥ºÏ†ïÏùÄ ÎèôÏùºÌïòÎ©∞, nginx ÏÑ§Ï†ïÎßå Ï°∞Ï†ïÌïòÎ©¥ Îê©ÎãàÎã§:server {   # ...   # <sub-path>Ïóê Î∞∞Ìè¨ÌïòÎ†§Îäî ÏÑúÎ∏å Í≤ΩÎ°úÎ•º ÏûÖÎ†•   location /<sub-path>/  {       # Ïó¨Í∏∞Ïùò <sub-path>Îäî ÏúÑÏôÄ ÎèôÏùºÌïòÍ≤å Ïú†ÏßÄ       rewrite ^/<sub-path>/(.*)$ /$1 break;       proxy_pass            http://127.0.0.1:6752;       proxy_http_version    1.1;       proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;       proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";       proxy_set_header      Host $host;       proxy_set_header      X-Real-IP $remote_addr;       proxy_set_header      X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;   }   # Ïó¨Í∏∞Ïùò <sub-path>Îäî ÏúÑÏôÄ ÎèôÏùºÌïòÍ≤å Ïú†ÏßÄ   location /<sub-path> {       return 301 $scheme://$host$request_uri/;   } } ÏÑ§Ï†ïÏùÑ Ï°∞Ï†ïÌïú ÌõÑ nginxÎ•º Ïû¨ÏãúÏûëÌïòÎ©¥ ÏÑúÎ∏å Í≤ΩÎ°úÎ°ú Ï†ëÍ∑ºÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Nginx IP ÌôîÏù¥Ìä∏Î¶¨Ïä§Ìä∏ ÏÑ§Ï†ï ÏòàÏãú: server {   location / {     # Ï†ëÍ∑º ÌóàÏö©Ìï† IP     allow <ip>;     # allow Ïô∏Ïùò Î™®Îì† ÌÅ¥ÎùºÏù¥Ïñ∏Ìä∏ Ï†ëÍ∑º Í±∞Î∂Ä     deny all;   } } Nginx HTTP Ïù∏Ï¶ù ÏÑ§Ï†ï, Ï†ëÍ∑º Ïãú Í≥ÑÏ†ïÍ≥º ÎπÑÎ∞ÄÎ≤àÌò∏ ÌïÑÏöî: Î®ºÏ†Ä htpasswdÎ°ú Í≥ÑÏ†ï/ÎπÑÎ∞ÄÎ≤àÌò∏ ÌååÏùº ÏÉùÏÑ±: # Ïã§Ìñâ ÌõÑ ÎπÑÎ∞ÄÎ≤àÌò∏ ÏûÖÎ†• Î∞è ÌôïÏù∏ ÌïÑÏöî htpasswd -c /etc/nginx/.htpasswd <ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎ™Ö>; Í∑∏ Îã§Ïùå nginx ÌååÏùºÏóêÏÑú auth_basic Î™®Îìà ÏÑ§Ï†ï: server {   location / {     auth_basic "PageSpy ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Ïóê Ï†ëÍ∑ºÌïòÎ†§Î©¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎ™ÖÍ≥º ÎπÑÎ∞ÄÎ≤àÌò∏Î•º ÏûÖÎ†•ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî";     auth_basic_user_file /etc/nginx/.htpasswd;     proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;     proxy_http_version    1.1;     proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;     proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   }   location ~ /(api|page-spy|plugin) {     proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:6752;     proxy_http_version    1.1;     proxy_set_header      Upgrade $http_upgrade;     proxy_set_header      Connection "upgrade";   } } ÎßàÏßÄÎßâÏúºÎ°ú nginx ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Î•º Ïû¨ÏãúÏûëÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

Ïù¥Îäî Îß§Ïö∞ ÌòëÏ°∞Ï†ÅÏù∏ Í≥†Í∞ùÏù¥Î©∞ PC ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Ïù∏ Í≤ΩÏö∞Ïóê Ï†ÅÌï©ÌïòÏßÄÎßå, Ïù¥Îü¨Ìïú Ï†ÑÏ†ú Ï°∞Í±¥ÏùÄ Îß§Ïö∞ ÍπåÎã§Î°≠ÏäµÎãàÎã§.Í∑∏Î†áÎã§Î©¥ H5 ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Î•º ÌîÑÎ°úÎçïÏÖòÏóê Î∞∞Ìè¨ÌñàÏùÑ Îïå PageSpyÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ†§Î©¥ Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å Ìï¥Ïïº Ìï†ÍπåÏöî? Î™®Îì† ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏóêÍ≤å ÌôúÏÑ±ÌôîÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏùÄ ÌòÑÏã§Ï†ÅÏù¥ÏßÄ ÏïäÏäµÎãàÎã§.PageSpyÏùò ÌôúÏÑ±Ìôî Í≥ºÏ†ïÏùÄ Ï¥ù Îëê Îã®Í≥ÑÏûÖÎãàÎã§: head ÌÉúÍ∑∏ÏóêÏÑú <script>Î°ú SDK Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïò§Í∏∞ Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Ìôî PageSpyÎäî Îëê Î≤àÏß∏ Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Ìôî Îã®Í≥Ñ Ï†ÑÍπåÏßÄÎäî Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïò® <script>Í∞Ä ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Ïóê Ïñ¥Îñ§ ÏòÅÌñ•ÎèÑ Ï£ºÏßÄ ÏïäÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÌäπÏ†ï ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎ•º ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ÌïòÎ†§Î©¥ Îëê Î≤àÏß∏ Îã®Í≥ÑÍ∞Ä ÌïµÏã¨ÏûÖÎãàÎã§: Ïñ¥Îñ§ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏùò Îã®ÎßêÏóêÏÑú PageSpyÎ•º Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§ÌôîÌï† Í≤ÉÏù∏Í∞Ä. Ïù¥Ïóê ÎåÄÌï¥ Îëê Í∞ÄÏßÄ Î∞©ÏïàÏù¥ ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§: HTML ÎèôÏ†Å ÏùëÎãµ: ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä HTMLÏùÑ ÏöîÏ≤≠Ìï† Îïå ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏùò Í≥†Ïú† ÏãùÎ≥ÑÏûêÎ•º ÏñªÏùÑ Ïàò ÏûàÍ≥† HTMLÏóê ÎèôÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Ï£ºÏûÖÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎã§Î©¥, ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏóêÍ≤å HTMLÏùÑ Î∞òÌôòÌïòÍ∏∞ Ï†ÑÏóê <script>ÏôÄ Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Ìôî Î°úÏßÅÏùÑ Ï£ºÏûÖÌï†ÏßÄ Í≤∞Ï†ïÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÎèôÏùºÌïú Ïù¥Î¶ÑÏùò ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏Ïù¥ Ï§ëÎ≥µ Îì±Î°ùÎêòÎ©¥ ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Îäî Ìïú Î≤àÎßå Îì±Î°ùÎêòÎ©∞, ÏΩòÏÜîÏóê Í≤ΩÍ≥† Î©îÏãúÏßÄÍ∞Ä Ï∂úÎ†•Îê©ÎãàÎã§. ko.title: socketStore
ko.content: WebSocket Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Î•º ÎûòÌïëÌïòÏó¨ Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Ïù¥Î≤§Ìä∏ Îì±Î°ù, ÏßÄÏ†ïÎêú Î©îÏãúÏßÄ ÏàòÏã† ÌõÑ ÏΩúÎ∞± Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞, Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Î∏åÎ°úÎìúÏ∫êÏä§Ìä∏ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†úÍ≥µÌï©ÎãàÎã§. ÌÉÄÏûÖ interface SocketStoreType {   addListener(type: InteractiveType, fn: InteractiveEventCallback): void;   addListener(type: InternalType, fn: InternalEventCallback): void;   removeListener(type: InteractiveType, fn: InteractiveEventCallback): void;   removeListener(type: InternalType, fn: InternalEventCallback): void;   dispatchEvent(type: InteractiveType | InternalType, data: InteractiveEvent): void;   dispatchEvent(type: InternalType, data: any): void;   broadcastMessage(message: MessageItem, noCache?: boolean): void; } ÏÉÅÏÑ∏ Ï†ïÎ≥¥ addListener() / removeListener() / dispatchEvent()Ïùò Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Îß§Í∞úÎ≥ÄÏàòÎäî Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Ïú†ÌòïÏù¥Î©∞, Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Ïú†ÌòïÏùÄ **"ÎåÄÌôîÌòï"**Í≥º "ÎÇ¥Î∂Ä" Îëê Í∞ÄÏßÄÎ°ú Î∂ÑÎ•òÎê©ÎãàÎã§: "ÎåÄÌôîÌòï" Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Ïú†ÌòïÏùÄ ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ Ï∏°Í≥ºÏùò ÏÉÅÌò∏ ÏûëÏö©Ïóê ÏÇ¨Ïö©Îê©ÎãàÎã§. Ïòà: ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ Ï∏° Ïò®ÎùºÏù∏, ÌÅ¥ÎùºÏù¥Ïñ∏Ìä∏Î°ú ÏΩîÎìú Ïã§Ìñâ Ï†ÑÏÜ°, Í∞ùÏ≤¥ ÏÉÅÏÑ∏ Ï†ïÎ≥¥ ÌôïÏû• ÌÅ¥Î¶≠ Îì±Ïù¥ Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Ïù¥Î≤§Ìä∏Î°ú SDKÏóê Ï†ÑÏÜ°ÎêòÎ©∞, SDKÎäî ÌïÑÏöîÏóê Îî∞Îùº ÏùëÎãµÌï©ÎãàÎã§. "ÎÇ¥Î∂Ä" Î©îÏãúÏßÄ Ïú†ÌòïÏùÄ ÌòÑÏû¨ ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ Í∞Ñ ÏÉÅÌò∏ ÏûëÏö©Ïóê ÏÇ¨Ïö©Îê©ÎãàÎã§. Ïòà: Í∞Å ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏Ïù¥ Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º ÏÉùÏÑ±Ìïú ÌõÑ socketStore.dispatchEvent('public-data')Î•º ÌÜµÌï¥ Ïù¥Î≤§Ìä∏Î•º Î∞úÏÉùÏãúÌÇ§Î©¥, ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏Ïù∏ DataHarborPluginÏù¥ Ïù¥ Ïù¥Î≤§Ìä∏Î•º Í∞êÏßÄÌïòÏó¨ Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÎ°ú Ï≤òÎ¶¨Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. broadcastMessage()Îäî Î©îÏãúÏßÄÎ•º Î∏åÎ°úÎìúÏ∫êÏä§Ìä∏Ìï©ÎãàÎã§. Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Îß§Í∞úÎ≥ÄÏàòÎäî Í∞Å ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ÏóêÏÑú ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ Ï∏°ÏúºÎ°ú Î≥¥ÎÇ¥Îäî Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Ïù¥Î©∞, Îëê Î≤àÏß∏ Îß§Í∞úÎ≥ÄÏàò noCacheÎäî ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏Ïù¥ socketStoreÏóê ÌòÑÏû¨ Ï†ÑÏÜ° Ï§ëÏù∏ Î©îÏãúÏßÄÎ•º Ï∫êÏãúÌï¥Ïïº ÌïòÎäîÏßÄ Ïó¨Î∂ÄÎ•º ÏïåÎ¶¨Îäî Îç∞ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Îê©ÎãàÎã§. Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º Ï∫êÏãúÌïòÎäî Î™©Ï†ÅÏùÄ ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ Ï∏°Ïù¥ "Ïò®ÎùºÏù∏" ÏÉÅÌÉúÍ∞Ä Îêú ÌõÑ Ïù¥Ï†Ñ Î©îÏãúÏßÄÎ•º Î≥º Ïàò ÏûàÎèÑÎ°ù ÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ÏßÄÎßå, Î™®Îì† Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º Ï∫êÏãúÌï† ÌïÑÏöîÎäî ÏóÜÏäµÎãàÎã§. Ïòà: ÌÅ¥ÎùºÏù¥Ïñ∏Ìä∏Í∞Ä ÎÑ§Ìä∏ÏõåÌÅ¨ ÏöîÏ≤≠ÏùÑ ÏãúÏûëÌï† Îïå, ÏÑ±Í≥µ ÎòêÎäî Ïã§Ìå®ÏôÄ Í¥ÄÍ≥ÑÏóÜÏù¥ ÏµúÏ¢Ö ÏÉÅÌÉúÎßå Ï∫êÏãúÌïòÎ©¥ Îê©ÎãàÎã§. ÏòàÏãú // ConsolePluginÏùò Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ Íµ¨ÌòÑÏùÄ Î¶¨Ìè¨ÏßÄÌÜ†Î¶¨Î•º Ï∞∏Ï°∞ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî class ConsolePlugin implements PageSpyPlugin {   onInit({ socketStore }) {     socketStore.addListener('debug', ({ source }, reply) => {       ...     })     socketStore.broadcastMessage(...)   } }

ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ Ìò∏Ï∂ú ÏàúÏÑúÎäî Îã§ÏùåÍ≥º Í∞ôÏäµÎãàÎã§:    *   1. enforce: "pre" ÏÜçÏÑ±ÏùÑ Í∞ÄÏßÑ ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏;    *   2. enforce ÏÜçÏÑ±Ïù¥ ÏóÜÎäî ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏;    *   3. enforce: "post" ÏÜçÏÑ±ÏùÑ Í∞ÄÏßÑ ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏;    */   public abstract enforce?: PluginOrder;   // new PageSpy() Ìò∏Ï∂ú Ïãú Ïã§ÌñâÎê©ÎãàÎã§   public abstract onInit: (params: OnInitParams) => any;   // PageSpy Î†åÎçîÎßÅ ÏôÑÎ£å ÌõÑ Ìò∏Ï∂úÎê©ÎãàÎã§(Î†åÎçîÎßÅ ÌîÑÎ°úÏÑ∏Ïä§Í∞Ä ÏûàÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞)   public abstract onMounted?: (params: OnMountedParams) => any;   // ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä PageSpyÎ•º Îçî Ïù¥ÏÉÅ ÌïÑÏöîÎ°ú ÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏùÑ Îïå, ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ÏùÄ Î¶¨ÏÖã/Î≥µÍµ¨ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïïº Ìï©ÎãàÎã§   public abstract onReset?: () => any; } export interface OnInitParams {   // ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä Ï†ÑÎã¨Ìïú Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Ìôî Îß§Í∞úÎ≥ÄÏàòÍ∞Ä Î≥ëÌï©Îêú ÏÑ§Ï†ï Ï†ïÎ≥¥   config: Required<InitConfig>;   // socket Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Î•º ÎûòÌïëÌïú Í≤ÉÏúºÎ°ú, ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ Í∞úÎ∞úÏûêÎäî Ïù¥ ÏÜçÏÑ±ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ Ï∏°/APIÏôÄ ÏÉÅÌò∏ÏûëÏö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§   socketStore: SocketStoreType; } export interface OnMountedParams {   // PageSpyÍ∞Ä Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌïòÎäî Î£®Ìä∏ ÎÖ∏Îìú   root?: HTMLDivElement;   // PageSpyÍ∞Ä Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌïòÎäî ÌåùÏóÖÏùò Î£®Ìä∏ ÎÖ∏Îìú   content?: HTMLDivElement;   // socket Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§Î•º ÎûòÌïëÌïú Í≤ÉÏúºÎ°ú, ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ Í∞úÎ∞úÏûêÎäî Ïù¥ ÏÜçÏÑ±ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ ÎîîÎ≤ÑÍ∑∏ Ï∏°/APIÏôÄ ÏÉÅÌò∏ÏûëÏö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§   socketStore: SocketStoreType; }
